GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTES THE GRANTS UPON REQUEST BY THE GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS AND AWARDS. THE ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHES THE BUDGET FOR EACH PROJECT AND MONITORS THE EXPENDITURES. EACH MONTH THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS AND AWARDS REQUESTS THE GRANT FUND TO COVER THE EXPENDITURE FOR THE PROJECT BUDGET. THE ORGANIZATION HAS ALSO DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDIT, WHICH TESTS THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER COMPLIANCE FOR FEDERAL GRANT COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid Office follows Dept. of Education and other applicable regulations, subject to yearly A133 audit.
RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON A VARIETY OF FACTORS, SUCH AS FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AND COURSE OF STUDY, AS STIPULATED BY THE AWARD/ENDOWMENT CRITERIA.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AS DETERMINED THROUGH INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE STUDENT FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). MANAGEMENT AWARDS MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS THAT QUALIFY, BASED ON DONOR STIPULATIONS (I.E. SPECIFIC MAJORS, LOCALITY, ETC.) AND AWARDS FEDERAL, STATE, AND PRIVATE NEED BASED AWARDS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO STUDENTS FOR THEIR HIGHER EDUCATION. FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships and stipends are available to undergraduate students and graduate students through the admissions process. Once awarded, depending on the type of aid, payment is credited to either the student account or directly to the student. All payments are monitored and approved by the Financial Services department before payment is applied or paid to the student. All students receiving scholarships and stipends have been selected on a non-discriminatory basis.Faculty enrichment grant opportunities are available to full-time and part-time faculty teaching in a degree program. Selections are based on the merit of the proposal and reviewed by members of a selection committee. Payments are monitored by the Dean's office and all payments are approved by the Vice Provost and School Finance department before payment is made.

THE UNIVERSITY OF DENVER HAS A UNIVERSITY WIDE SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT ALLOCATION SYSTEM THAT DISTRIBUTES GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO ALL DIVISIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE PURPOSE AND ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE ESTABLISHED AT THE FUND LEVEL. THE EXPENDITURE OF THIS FINANCIAL RESOURCE IS MONITORED THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE SOFTWARE SYSTEM WHICH ALLOWS FOR RECONCILIATION, ELIGIBILITY CHECKS, AND PREVENTS OVER EXPENDITURE. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO PARTICIPATES IN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AUDITS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN RECIPIENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO THE RECIPIENTS' TUITION AND FEE RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT AND IS APPLIED TO ANY OUTSTANDING CHARGES PRIOR TO DISBURSEMENT OF ANY EXCESS AMOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: Student Financial Aid STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT, DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, AND ACADEMIC INTERESTS. FUNDS ARE PROVIDED BY SOURCES SUCH AS FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; PRIVATE DONORS SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, INDIVIDUALS AND FOUNDATIONS; THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED FINANCIAL AID FUNDS; AND THE COLLEGE'S OPERATING BUDGET. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE UP TO A LIMIT OF THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE MONITORED EXTENSIVELY IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT STUDENTS ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND THAT THEY DO NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THEIR DEMONSTRATED NEED. ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN APPROPRIATE.

MONITORING PROCEDURES PART II: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR FINANCIAL AFFAIRS. RESPONSIBILITY CENTER HEADS WITHIN THE UNIVERSITY ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE GENERAL USE OF UNIVERSITY FUNDS FOR APPROVED USES. DISBURSEMENT REQUESTS FOR GRANT FUNDS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM (FAIS) ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER. WHEN THE REQUESTOR IS ALSO THE FAIS ACCOUNT ADMINISTRATOR OR THE HEAD OF THE RESPONSIBILITY CENTER, THE GRANT FUNDING REQUEST MUST BE SIGNED BY THE NEXT HIGHER LEVEL ADMINISTRATOR. THE UNIVERSITY'S DISBURSEMENT PROCESS IDENTIFIES AND RECORDS PAYMENTS TO BOTH U.S. AND FOREIGN INDIVIDUALS/ENTITIES. THE UNIVERSITY EMPLOYS APPROPRIATE MEASURES TO REDUCE THE RISK THAT ANY GRANT FUNDING PROVIDED IS NOT USED FOR NON-CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR EXPLOITATION BY TERRORIST ORGANIZATIONS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, UNIVERSITY ATTENDANCE AND/OR PARTICIPATION AT SPONSORED EVENTS AND ONGOING REVIEWS OF THE SPECIALLY DESIGNATED NATIONALS LIST PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY. FOR RESEARCH SUBCONTRACTS,THE INITIAL DETERMINATION OF ELIGIBILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF THE ENTITY LIES JOINTLY BETWEEN THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI)/DEPARTMENT AND THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH. THE PI/DEPARTMENT IDENTIFIES THE ENTITY USUALLY BASED UPON THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF THE PI EVIDENCED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK. DOCUMENTATION IS OBTAINED FROM THE ENTITY WHICH IS REVIEWED. UPON SUBMISSION, THE OFFICE OF RESEARCH LOOKS FOR THIS DOCUMENTATION SO THAT IT MEETS SPONSOR AND UNIVERSITY REQUIREMENTS. IF AND WHEN THE PROJECT IS FUNDED, THE DEPARTMENT INITIATES A SUBCONTRACT REQUEST. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: MONITORING PROCEDURES PART III GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE INSTITUTION DOES MAINTAIN RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE. THE RECORDS, ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED BY EITHER THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID, THE STUDENTS' SCHOOL DEPARTMENT, THE BENEFITS SECTION OF HUMAN RESOURCES, OR THE FACULTY RECORDS OFFICE. GRANT FUNDS THAT ARE RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE NOT REFUNDABLE IN CASH TO THE STUDENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SYSTEM. GRANTS THAT ARE NOT RESTRICTED IN THEIR USE AND ARE REFUNDABLE TO THE STUDENTS ARE NOT MONITORED.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REFLECTS THE ACTUAL NUMBER OF STUDENTS AND EMPLOYEES WHO RECEIVED THE ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY AWARDS ITS INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED STUDENYS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. EACH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM HAS DIFFERENT ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, APPLICATION DEADLINES AND SEPARATE APPLICATION PROCEDURES. APPLICATIONS FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCEPTED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS CAN RANGE FROM A FEW HUNDRED DOLLARS TO SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS. ONCE THE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT HAS BEEN SELECTED AND THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD DETERMINED, THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES IS NOTIFIED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE OR DEPARTMENT. THE SCHOLARSHIP AWARD IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND MAINTAINS RECORDS FOR GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ITS STUDENTS. MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY AWARDS A PORTION OF THE REMAINING CORPUS FROM THE PREVIOUS SALE OF LOANS AS A RESULT OF THE SCHOOL AS LENDER LOAN PROGRAM (A PROGRAM UNDER THE FEDERAL FAMILY EDUCATION LOAN PROGRAM FFELP) AS STUDENT NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. THE AWARDS ARE FUNDED FROM MIDWESTERN UNIVERSITY FOUNDATION. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THEIR FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE THEN CREDITED AGAINST THE STUDENTS' TUITION BILL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: CONTRIBUTIONS MADE BY LANCASTER GENERAL HOSPITAL MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE MISSION & COMMUNITY BENEFIT COMMITTEE: 1) GAPS IN HEALTH CARE SERVICES WILL BE REDUCED, 2) RESOURCES WILL BE DIRECTED TO DESIGNATED PRIMARY AND SECONDARY HEALTH PRIORITIES, HEALTH PROMOTION, AND PREVENTION INITIATIVES, 3) INITIATIVES WILL DRIVE COST-EFFECTIVE, COMMUNITY CARE/INTERVENTIONS THAT PROMOTE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITY, 4) INITIATIVES WILL BE RESPONSIVE TO THE NEEDS OF SPECIAL/DISPARATE POPULATIONS, 5) ENDOWMENT OR CAPITAL CAMPAIGN REQUESTS WILL NOT BE FINANCIALLY SUPPORTED, 6) ONLY TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS AND GOVERNMENTAL INITIATIVES AT THE LOCAL LEVEL THAT RELATE TO LANCASTER GENERAL HOSPITAL'S MISSION WILL BE SUPPORTED, AND 7) ONGOING DEFICIT FUNDING WILL NOT BE PROVIDED UNLESS FUNDAMENTAL TO A LANCASTER GENERAL HOSPITAL HEALTH PRIORITY AND/OR THE CARE OF THE MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED. SCHOLARSHIPS AND LOANS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS AT THE PENNSYLVANIA COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES ON A NON-DISCRIMINATORY BASIS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND CLINICAL PERFORMANCE.
The College's financial aid department monitors and maintains records regarding all financial aid awards.

ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 IN RECOGNITION OF THE CLOSE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE COLLEGE AND THE CITY OF BEVERLY, AN ANNUAL GIFT IS PRESENTED TO THE MAYOR OF THE CITY TO ASSIST IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE CITY OF BEVERLY'S INITIATIVES. ENDICOTT COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS THROUGH ITS OWN RESOURCES, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS. TO QUALIFY FOR SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT AID, A STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED IN AN APPROVED PROGRAM AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. MOST OF THE AID PROGRAMS REQUIRE THAT STUDENTS DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. ENDICOTT AWARDS ARE MADE ON A FUNDS-AVAILABLE BASIS TO DESERVING STUDENTS. THE COLLEGE MAKES EVERY EFFORT TO ENSURE THAT A QUALITY EDUCATION IS AVAILABLE TO ALL STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF INCOME LEVEL, RACE, RELIGION, DISABILITY, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, AGE, OR GENDER.

ORGANIZATIONS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS FUNDS INSIDE THE US SCHEDULE I, PART IV PART I, LINE 2, THE UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO FOLLOWS THESE PROCEDURES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES. THE UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT AT THE PROPOSAL STAGE BEFORE FUNDING IS APPROVED. UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENT ADMINISTRATORS AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR WILL REVIEW INVOICES AND CERTIFY AS TO ALLOWABILITY AND APPROPRIATENESS OF CHARGES. CENTRAL SPONSORED AWARD ACCOUNTING WILL ALSO PERFORM A REVIEW THAT THE EXPENDITURES FALL WITHIN THE CONTRACT AMOUNT AND PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.

Rush provides grants and assistance to organizations that are recognized public charities and to individuals primarily associated with the medical field. Rush maintains contact with the grantees through the performance of its exempt purpose.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPT. OF ED., THE AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE GRANTS APPLICATION. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES.

THE OFFICES OF ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL AID OVERSEE THE AWARDING OF BOTH NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID AND MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ONCE A STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION PROCESS AND IS FOUND ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED AND/OR MERIT BASED AID, SHE WILL RECEIVE A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE DETAILING THE COMBINATION OF SOURCES USED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. USAGE IS MONITORED BY VIRTUE OF DIRECT ACCOUNT POSTING.

The University provides scholarships to individuals to attend the University. Scholarship recipients are selected based on a written application which is reviewed by the Financial Aid Department and/or scholarship committee. Scholarships are awarded based on a combination of student financial need and merit and are applied directly to the student's account as a reduction in tuition and fees. The University monitors each recipient student to ensure that he/she remains an active, enrolled student and satisfies the academic and other criteria for maintaining the scholarship. If the student withdraws from the University or fails to meet the scholarship criteria, any remaining scholarship funds are returned to the funding program to be awarded to another student.
The use of grant funds is monitored through student financial aid and billing process.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON ESTABLISHED FEDERAL AND COLLEGE POLICIES. AWARDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AS CREDITS TO TUITION AND OTHER FEES.

YESHIVA UNIVERSITY CONDUCTS SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE ACTIVITIES OF FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTENTIONS AND GUIDELINES OF THE FELLOWSHIP GRANT.

THE $99,327,028 IN GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, INCLUDING EMERGENCY STUDENT ASSISTANCE GRANTS. FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON ELIGIBILITY DETERMINED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC BASED AID IS AWARDED BY THE DISTINGUISHED SCHOLARS COMMITTEE. BOTH FACULTY AND ENROLLMENT SERVICES ADMINISTRATORS COMPRISE THE COMMITTEE.

THE COLLEGE'S DEPARTMENT OF FINANCIAL AID REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE FUNDS. THE CONTROLLER AND DIRECTOR OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AND APPLY GENERAL ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES IN BOOKING THE FUNDS ON FINANCIAL RECORDS.
The Medical Center only makes grants to its related, tax-exempt foundation, Beebe Medical Foundation.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. The University may make donations to support its town or non-profit organizations. In these instances, the University generally does not monitor the ultimate use of the funds as these amounts are unrestricted grants to municipalities or organizations that are recognized as being described in Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c). GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BASED ON A NEEDS ANALYSIS AND APPLIED TO STUDENT CHARGES THAT SUPPORT COST OF ATTENDANCE. STUDENT CHARGES ARE USED IN SUPPORT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION.
The college maintains detailed records in its database of all scholarships awarded

All financial aid grants and scholarships to students who are United States citizens are recorded in the financial aid management software, PowerFAIDS, by amount per semester. Student Financial Services staff determine student eligibility based on a consistently applied need analysis formula which calculates the expected family contribution (EFC). The EFC is subtracted from the total cost of attendance to equal the financial aid eligibility. The financial aid grant amount is determined based on consistently applied packaging formulas to meet the full calculated need of each student. In addition to the need based aid that the College awards, there are some grants that are awarded based on merit. Financial aid grant funds are monitored through the financial aid management software, PowerFAIDS. Staff who will be awarding financial aid grant funds are trained to adhere to these policies and procedures. The financial aid grant information is transferred from PowerFAIDS to the student information system, Ellucian Colleague, via a regularly scheduled interface. When all institutional grant disbursement requirements are met, the funds are disbursed to the student account in Colleague. The funds are credited against any billed charges that have been previously posted. If this transaction results in a credit balance, the credit may be refunded to the student in the form of a check. The student initiates this refund process by submitting a completed Disbursement Form or Credit Balance Request Form. Student eligibility is monitored throughout the period of enrollment and adjustments are made, as necessary, for changes in enrollment status according to the College's published refund policies.*During the fiscal year, the College conducted grant-funded research. Two of the research grants included collaboration with institutions whose faculty are accomplished in their respective fields of study.*Infrequently at the discretion of the President or Vice President for Finance and Administration, the College makes donations to support the town or nonprofit organizations. In these instances, the College generally does not monitor the ultimate use of the funds as these amounts are unrestricted grants to municipalities and organizations that are recognized as being described in Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3). In certain instances when the College grants funds for specified use by the town, the College maintains a written agreement that such grant will be used for the designated purpose.

INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ARE AWARDED PURSUANT TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WHICH CONSIDER A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ABILITY, ARTISTIC ABILITY AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TO CONTINUE RECEIVING INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS FUNDED BY DONORS MUST MEET THE SPECIFIED SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS, IF ANY, AS WELL AS MAINTAIN ACADEMIC STANDARDS AND MAKE SATISFACTORY PROGRESS TOWARDS GRADUATION.

Saint Louis University offers a number of institutional grants and scholarships. Each program has specific awarding criteria and individual rules for awarding set up in the Banner (ERP) system. Initially, awards are determined by the Office of Student Financial Services or the department administrators will determine and notify the Office of Student Financial Services. Awards are then posted accordingly and disbursed onto a student's account. Students registered in the Banner (ERP) system will be awarded and paid using the student information system disbursement rules. Controls are in place to monitor or designate if charges and resulting payment of aid is applicable to the type of program or fee by use of separate detail codes for each program.
Not applicable.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III - ACCOUNTING FOR CASH AND NONCASH ASSISTANCE
ExplntnTxt: PAYMENTS/REIMBURSEMENTS DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED CASH ASSISTANCE. PAYMENTS TO VENDORS TO BENEFIT RECIPIENTS, OR THE PURCHASE OF NONCASH ITEMS TO BE GIVEN TO RECIPIENTS ARE CONSIDERED NONCASH ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART III, COLUMN B - NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS IS BASED ON FINANCIAL AID RECORDS OF RECIPIENTS. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR PRIZES AND AWARDS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH PRIZES/AWARDS), AND THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS BENEFITTED OR NUMBER OF ITEMS PURCHASED (NONCASH PRIZES/AWARDS). THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FOR STUDENT RESEARCH AND TRAVEL GRANTS IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE NUMBER OF PAYEES (CASH GRANTS); AND/OR THE NUMBER OF RESEARCH PROJECTS FUNDED (CASH AND NONCASH GRANTS).
THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD.

COMMUNITY MEDICAL CENTER (CMC) DOES NOT AWARD GRANTS; CMC PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR 501(C)(3) STATUS UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, LIMITED 501(C)(4) ORGANIZATIONS BASED ON EXPLICIT CRITERIA, PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE ACTIVITIES FURTHER THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF CMC. CMC NOTIFIES THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS OF THE INTENT AND PURPOSE OF THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION. ORGANIZATIONS SEEKING SUPPORT MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT THEY EFFECTIVELY MEET AN IMPORTANT COMMUNITY HEALTH NEED.

PERIODIC RECONCILIATIONS (MONTHLY AND ANNUAL) ARE PERFORMED, EXCEPTION REPORTS ARE REVIEWED AND GENERATED, AND SEGREGATION OF DUTIES EXISTS BETWEEN AWARDING, POSTING TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND DRAWING DOWN OF FUNDS.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.)

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S.: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES CONTINUOUSLY MONITORS STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES ENSURES EQUITY BY APPLYING ALL NEED ANALYSIS FORMULAS CONSISTENTLY ACROSS THE INSTITUTION'S POPULATION OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID APPLICANTS AND PROVIDES SERVICES THAT DO NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, GENDER ETHNICITY, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RELIGION, DISABILITY, AGE, OR ECONOMIC STATUS. THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES VARIOUS FORMS OF FINANCIAL AID FROM THE GOVERNMENT TO SUPPORT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO THE STUDENTS. THE TYPES OF GOVERNMENT ASSISTANCE THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: FEDERAL PELL GRANT FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT (SEOG) FEDERAL ACADEMIC COMPETITIVENESS GRANT (ACG) FEDERAL NATIONAL SMART GRANTS (NSMART) FEDERAL DIRECT LOAN PROGRAM FEDERAL WORK STUDY PROGRAM. THE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES GOVERNMENT FUNDING TO SUPPORT ITS ORGANIZED RESEARCH PROGRAMS. THESE GOVERNMENTAL GRANTS HELP TO FURTHER THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION BY SUPPORTING ORGANIZED RESEARCH EFFORTS IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND PUBLIC SERVICES. THE PUBLIC AGENCIES THAT SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE: NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING & URBAN PROTECTION UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE ARTS THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE HUMANITIES

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: MONITORING GRANTS
Procedure for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds Inside U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS MONITORED THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF DIRECTLY APPLYING SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT AT THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET TUITION AND FEES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: DUE TO THE VARIOUS TYPES OF GRANT FUND EXPENDITURES THE UNIVERSITY USES MULTIPLE INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF U.S. GRANT FUNDS AND ASSISTANCE. FELLOWSHIPS, PRIZES AND STIPEND PAYMENTS ARE MADE THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL SERVICES AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. THE PROCESS REQUIRES PRE-APPROVAL BY A PARTICULAR DEPARTMENT-HEAD AND SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION AND AUTHORIZATIONS ARE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO PROCESS A PAYMENT. A MAJORITY OF PAYMENTS ARE MADE VIA CHECK. FOR DOMESTIC SCHOLARSHIPS, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE (FAO) MAINTAINS AN INDEPENDENT FINANCIAL AID ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE FAO ADMINISTERS THE LISTING OF AWARD RECIPIENTS AND RECONCILES, ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE CORRESPONDING EXPENSES WITH THE UNIVERSITY GENERAL LEDGER SYSTEM. THE CASH GRANTS ARE ALSO REFLECTED ON EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNT. THE FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE INDEPENDENTLY RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS AFTER ALL REQUIRED SYSTEM-FEED DOCUMENTATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED. ADDITIONALLY, ALL FEDERAL SCHOLARSHIP ACTIVITIES ARE MONITORED SEPARATELY BY THE SPONSORED ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT (SPA). FOR SUBCONTRACT RESEARCH GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A SPONSORED RESEARCH ACCOUNTING (SPA) DEPARTMENT WHICH HAS FINANCIAL OVERSIGHT FOR ALL GRANT AND CONTRACT ACTIVITY. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF A GRANT ALONG WITH THE COMPLIANCE ACTIVITIES. SPECIFIC GRANT-RELATED EXPENDITURE ACTIVITIES ARE PROCESSED BY THE UNIVERSITY ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT. SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING: A PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR (PI) NEGOTIATES SUBCONTRACTS WITH SUB-RECIPIENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST. WHEN AN AGREEMENT IS FULLY EXECUTED, IT MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE OFFICE OF SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING (SPA) ALONG WITH A COMPLETED CONSULTANT PAYMENT FORM. ANY ISSUES REGARDING SUB-RECIPIENT PERFORMANCE ARE REPORTED TO THE OFFICE OF THE VICE PROVOST AND SPA. ALSO, SPA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT ALL SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133 REQUIREMENTS.
All expenditures of Scholarships and Financial Aid grant funds are approved and monitored by the Financial Aid department for each student receiving funds.

St. Mary's Hospital of Richmond, Inc. complies with Bon Secours Health System, Inc.'s system-wide financial and accounting policies. Contributions are generally made as reimbursements for funds spent. In such cases, the donee/grantee organization must provide documentation to the filing organization before funds are approved for disbursement.
DESCRIBE PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATES AND MONITORS DONEES BASED ON PUBLIC AND PRIVATE DATA.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ACTIVE IN SCHOOL FUNCTIONS AND THE SOCIAL BETTERMENT OF THE PROFESSION OF CHIROPRACTORS AND ACUPUNCTURE. THE SCHOLARSHIPS REFLECT AN APPRECIATION OF THE SERVICE COMMITMENT AS WELL AS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. GRANTS, LOANS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC STATUS, ABILITY TO BENEFIT AND OTHER CRITERIA. DOCUMENTATION OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED ON FILE IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND IS SUBJECT TO ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT.

AS PART OF OUR MISSION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SELECTION BY A COMMITTEE UPON SUBMISSION OF AN APPLICATION TO BE USED TOWARDS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A TRIMESTER BASIS.
The organization makes cash donations to other charitable organizations to help further their exempt purposes.

American Heart Association- To provide community information on heart disease and direct them to complete a HRA, to provide women information on heart disease and warning signs of heart attack, and to support community awareness through participation in annual heart walk. Greater Belhaven Neighborhood- To support community awareness through participation in annual golf tournament and to support community information and research efforts regarding chronic diseases. American Cancer Society- To support the Cancer League's efforts for patient information and assistance programs, to support community awareness through annual Making Strides Walk for Breast Cancer, and to support community awareness through Passport for a Cure gala event. Jackson Heart Foundation - To support awareness in the young adult community regarding heart disease. Madison County School District - To support athletic trainers in the care of students during physical activities/games. Midtown Partners, Inc. - To support midtown community projects and partnerships with area non-profits. United Way of the Capital Area- To support early childhood literacy program and imagination library and to support Jackson Public School career exploration for high school freshmen. Jackson Preparatory School- To support faculty leadership program. Habitat for Humanity MS Capital Area- To support the organization's vision of providing a decent place to live for those in need.

All funds donated by individuals, corporations or foundations are recorded as temporarily restricted until funds are identified as applicable financial aid for a student. All awards are under the direction of the Financial Aid Director to ensure compliance with donors' directions.

The School awards scholarships to students which are funded from operations or from donations. The scholarships from operating funds are awarded on the basis of academic performance for continuing students or related parameters such as LSAT scores, GPA and completed application forms for entering students. Donor-funded scholarships are awarded based on criteria set forth by donors. The Associate Dean for Students and Admissions and The Office of Admissions communicate the availability of the scholarships, processes the applications and determines which applicants have qualified based on information provided by the Registrar's office for those awarded on the basis of academic performance. Additionally for those that are donor-funded, a Committee established by the School may be called upon to determine which applicants qualify based on donor-requirements. Once awarded, the scholarships are posted to the individual students' accounts. The Financial Aid Office maintains records of scholarship awards and ensures that these are factored into the calculation of how much federally funded financial aid each student is eligible to receive. After the initial award letters are sent out, additional scholarships may be awarded. The posting of additional scholarships triggers a re-evaluation of the student's eligibility for federally funded student loans, which may result in adjustments to the student's loan awarded.

AWARD FUNDS ARE BALANCED PERIODICALLY ACCORDING TO THE AWARD YEAR TIME FRAME AND ANY DISCREPENCIES ARE INVESTIGATED IMMEDIATELY. EACH AWARD FUND MAINTAINS RECORDS OF ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION CRITERIA AND AMOUNT AWARDED. THESE PARAMETERS MAY BE ADJUSTED ANNUALLY AND STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED ACCORDINGLY. MOST AWARDS ARE GRANTED FOR TUITION ONLY, BUT SOME MAY BE USED FOR BOOKS AND HOUSING, ETC. THE PARAMETERES ARE EITHER PUBLISHED IN THE HANDBOOK OR WITH THE AWARD PACKET AND APPLICATION.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR EACH COLLEGE CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS.

THE COLLEGE'S ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF OVERSEE THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THE GRANTS ARE MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GUIDELINES OR AGREEMENT SET FORTH, WHETHER THAT IS USE OF DONOR, GOVERNMENT OR INSTITUTIONAL SOURCES.

GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT ATTEND ONE OF THE COMPANY'S COLLEGES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS SUBMITTED BY STUDENTS OR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS, COMPARES THE APPLICATIONS WITH THE WRITTEN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND DETERMINES IF THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE AND THEN APPROVES OR REJECTS AN APPLICATION. A WRITTEN RECORD OF THE APPROVALS AND THE AMOUNTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS MAINTAINED. THE ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS ARE THEN NOTIFIED OF THE AMOUNT OF ANY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED AND A PRO RATA PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM THE COLLEGE, THE UNUSED PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CANCELLED.

OUR HONORS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO CURRENT STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. YELLOW RIBBON IS A PARTIAL MATCH OF FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AS PART OF A FEDERAL PROGRAM FOR QUALIFIED STUDENTS. THE OTHER SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO CURRENT STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND/OR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT.

The students complete applications for receipt of scholarship funds to be used for their education. These funds are then applied to their tuition balances. Awards are determined by a scholarship committee. Tuition discounts are also extended to qualified individuals.

FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO STUDENTS AT POINT PARK UNIVERSITY ARE DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, COMMUNITY SERVICE, ARTISTIC OR ATHLETIC TALENT AND FINANCIAL NEED ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS AND LOANS ARE DISTRIBUTED USING POWERFAIDS APPLICATION AND POSTED TO STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS IN JENZABAR (HIGHER EDUCATION INFORMATION SYSTEM). ANNUALLY THE FINANCIAL AID AREA IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

The organization complies with Bon Secours Health System, Inc.'s system-wide financial and accounting policies. Contributions are generally made as reimbursements for funds spent. In such cases, the donee/grantee organization must provide documentation to the filing organization before funds are approved for disbursement.
Estimate based on $25/fare

THE INSTITUTE'S STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THIS OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS AND FELLOWSHIP STIPENDS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE ARE DETERMINED TO BE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS BASED ON A REVIEW BY AN INDEPENDENT PANEL OF THE INDIVIDUAL'S ACADEMIC MERITS RELEVANT TO THE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM CONDUCTED AT THE INSTITUTE AND FINANCIAL NEED. EACH SEMESTER THE ORGANIZATION WILL REVIEW REGISTRATION RECORDS TO ENSURE THAT A STUDENT IS ENROLLED IN CLASSES BEFORE A SCHOLARSHIP OR FELLOWSHIP IS AWARDED. IF THE STUDENT WITHDRAWS BEFORE HALF OF THE SEMESTER IS COMPLETED, HE OR SHE IS REQUIRED TO REPAY THE ENTIRE SEMESTER'S AWARD. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS AFTER THE HALFWAY POINT OF THE SEMESTER, HE OR SHE IS ENTITLED TO RETAIN THE FULL AWARDED AMOUNT. THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS A LISTING OF ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS AND AMOUNTS AWARDED TO EACH STUDENT. ALL SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE UNRELATED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE AND ALSO UNRELATED TO THE OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION.

TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS MADE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES, OTHER THAN WORK STUDY GRANTS, ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND ARE NOT OTHERWISE DIVERTED FROM THE INTENDED USE, THE FACULTY DEPARTMENT THAT HAS BUDGETARY CONTROL OF THE FUNDS SELECTS AND MONITORS THE RECIPIENTS OF THESE GRANTS. FOR WORK STUDY GRANTS, THE FACULTY OR ADMINISTRATIVE DEPARTMENT WHERE THE STUDENT'S WORK WAS PERFORMED APPROVES ALL STUDENT WORK HOURS AND SUBMITS PAPERWORK TO THE PAYROLL OFFICE FOR PAYMENT TO THE STUDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedures for Monitoring the use of grant funds to U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 The college grants scholarships to students enrolled in the college's degree-granting program. The college determines student eligibility based upon the student's need. Some scholarships or grants are awarded based upon academic achievement. The college has a student financial assistance office that accumulates all required information from the students. The office awards scholarships based upon criteria established by the college.
GRANTS AWARDED ARE PART OF AN OVERALL SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IN WHICH CRITERIA AND AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE RECORDED BY GRANTEE.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 FOR THE PERIOD JULY 1, 2013 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2014, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTED FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AS WELL AS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. IF A STUDENT IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FEDERAL OR STATE BASED FINANCIAL AID, THE AID WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT AND NEED CRITERIA.

COSTS CHARGED TO SPONSORED AGREEMENTS ARE FULLY INTEGRATED WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM ACCUMULATES COSTS ACCORDING TO INDEX, FUND AND ACCOUNT CODE CATEGORIES. ASSOCIATED AND IDENTIFIED WITH EACH FUND ARE VARIOUS ATTRIBUTES SUCH AS PROJECT TITLE, SPONSOR, AND PRINCIPAL.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: RECORDS MAINTAINED FOR GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 The University has agreements with various government agencies regarding annual contributions. Also, Each year the University makes numerous small contributions to community organizations. THE UNIVERSITY'S Department of Community and Regional Affairs reviews requests from local non-profits, and looks to provide program support for organizations in the Princeton area who provide important services and resources to the community. All Contributions are evaluated to assure that they provide towards the betterment of the Princeton community at large. The University's Pace Center for Civic Engagement provides grant and support efforts by students, faculty, staff, and alumni to identify and address issues of public concern, to be actively engaged citizens, and to practice effective public leadership for the purpose of building stronger communities and societies throughout the world. THE UNDERGRADUATE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE UNDERGRADUATE NEED-BASED GRANTS. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S PRINCETON BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES. At the time of admission, graduate student fellowships are awarded on the basis of a combination of academic merit and financial need. All students must remain in good academic standing in order to receive funding. Students in certain programs receive research grants after their first year of study, While other students receive fellowships for the duration of their program. Graduate student fellowships are funded through a combination of university resources including endowment, general university funds, and/or departmental resources.

Schedule I, Part II In furtherance of its research activities, Princeton University makes sub-awards to other institutions that perform research in connection with research grants awarded to Princeton University. Princeton University does not categorize these sub-awards as "grants and other assistance" for Form 990 reporting, since the recipient organizations perform research services for the University and are considered independent contractors which serve the direct needs of the University. During the year ended June 30, 2014, Princeton University made sub-award payments to 190 recipient organizations totaling $34,680,729.

THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAVING RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE GRANT MONITORS SUBCONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE BASED ON THE PROGRAM'S TASKS AND GOALS. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE BEFORE AUTHORIZING THE SUBCONTRACTOR'S INVOICE FOR PAYMENT.

Students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Scholarships are awarded on a non-discriminatory basis.

ALL GRANTS PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE RELATED TO INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID FOR WHICH STUDENTS APPLY THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. ALL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON CERTAIN GUIDELINES AND IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNTS. ALL AWARDS ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATION AT THE INSTITUTION'S PHYSICAL LOCATION AND ONLINE COURSES IN THE UNITED STATES. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID.

The University awards grants, scholarships & student loans based on various, predefined criteria. Students must qualify for the assistance. Student enrollment and continuing eligibility are verified on an ongoing basis. The University also grants funds to its supporting organization, Point Loma Nazarene University Foundation. The use of these funds is monitored through direct oversight of the Foundation. The finance department of the University maintains the books and records of the Foundation.

Most, if not all student scholarships are credited to the student accounts without the funds passing through the students hands. Sources outside the university that provide scholarships are encouraged to remit payment directly to the university, which credits the student account upon receipt. Institutional aid is almost always credited directly to the student accounts.

THE METHODS USED TO MONITOR FUNDS INCORPORATE THE FOLLOWING CORE CONCEPTS: A) EXPECTATIONS ARE DOCUMENTED, B) A BUDGET IS ESTABLISHED, C) WRITTEN REPORTS ARE REQUIRED, D) THE COLLEGE BUDGET OFFICER REVIEWS REPORTS AND MONITORS THE RELATED BUDGET, E) THE COLLEGE BUDGET OFFICER CONTACTS OVERSEAS ORGANIZATIONS TO VERIFY THAT THE RECIPIENT IS ENGAGED AS PLANNED. METHOD 2: IN CASE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MONITORED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: Financial Aid is Awarded by Financial Aid professionals in accordance with College policies. Grants to organizations in Part II are to support local service organizations in the surrounding communities. FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III CASH GRANTS ARE CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED BY PROCEDURES THAT INSURE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS ARE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND OTHER SIMILAR NEEDS.

MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS & NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO ENROLLED STUDENTS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNT TO COVER TUITION & FEES. GRADE REPORTS ARE GENERATED FOR EACH TERM & EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS REVIEWED TO INSURE THEY ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO MAINTAIN THEIR GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING. NOTIFICATIONS ARE SENT BY THE DEAN OF THE COLLEGE TO ALERT DEPARTMENTS OF WITHDRAWALS. ALSO, FINANCIAL AID RUNS ENROLLMENT REPORTS EACH TERM TO CHECK THE NUMBER OF CREDIT HRS FOR EACH STUDENT. THIRD PARTY SOFTWARE IS ALSO CODED TO PREVENT THE CREDIT OF FUNDS TO A STUDENT WITHOUT ENROLLED HOURS.

THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO ENSURE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS OR DONOR RESTRICTIONS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH IN THE INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. "NEED BASED" FEDERAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL AID (FASFA).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: GEORGETOWN UNIVERSITY IS NOT A "GRANTMAKER" PER SE IN THAT ITS FUNDAMENTAL MISSION, AND PURPOSE FOR TAX-EXEMPTION, RELATES TO EDUCATION AND RESEARCH. HOWEVER, IN THE COURSE OF THESE MISSION-BASED ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY DOES MAKE PAYMENTS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR "GRANTMAKING" AS DEFINED BY THE INSTRUCTIONS TO SCHEDULE I OF THE FORM 990. THESE PAYMENTS FALL INTO TWO CATEGORIES: (1) STUDENT FINANCIAL AID - THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED EITHER ON FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT; THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE) DETERMINES STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID. VARIOUS ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR MERIT-BASED AID; AND (2) CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS - CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS MADE TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY.

AUGUSTANA HAS A POLICY AND PROCEDURE MANUAL THAT IS FOLLOWED WHEN DETERMINING NEED AND THE ORDER IN WHICH GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH ELECTRONIC COMPLIANCE CHECKS IN OUR STUDENT DATA SOFTWARE. CHECKS AND BALANCES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE PROPER AUTHORIZATION AND DISBURSEMENT OF FEDERAL FUNDS. INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THESE FUNCTIONS ARE ORGANIZED INDEPENDENTLY FROM ONE ANOTHER.

Haverford College scholarships are based solely on need. The College does not have any grant aid based on merit. Applicants can be asked to file the College Board Profile and the FAFSA. If eligible for federal aid, parent and student personal and business taxes must also be provided. Supplements for businesses and forms for non-custodial parents may also be required based on circumstances. College policy is reviewed in the form of appeals to the Financial Aid Committee made up of the Dean of Admissions, the Dean of the College and the VP of Finance and Chief Administrative Officer. Haverford scholarships are credited directly to the student's account for tuition, room, board, fees and other billed charges. Supplemental Education Opportunity Grants (FSEOG) are awarded based on family contribution. Eligibility is determined by the FAFSA and regulations determined by the U.S. Department of Education that students who receive Pell grants be provided FSEOG funds first. Other verification forms may be required if the student is selected including the Verification Statement, parent and student tax returns and non-tax filer statements. FSEOG awards are credited directly to the student's account for tuition, room, board and other billed charges. FSEOG awards are audited annually by the College's outside auditors in conjunction with the A-133 federal funds audit. Student internships are awarded through an application and committee review process. The internship awards are paid directly to the student for travel, room, board and other fees. This assistance enables the students to engage in unpaid internships in a variety of domestic and international locations. Some of the areas of study include Humanities, global Citizenship, Sciences and Entrepreneurship.

PART I, LINE 2 USC Neighborhood Outreach funds are distributed through a competitive grant making process. A grant review committee comprised of university faculty and staff volunteers review all grants and provide funding recommendations based on a set of criteria. All final grant award decisions are made by Civic Engagement. USC Neighborhood Outreach monitors the grant awards through an interim report six months into the project and a final, cumulative report at the end of the project. We conduct adhoc site visits to observe the program and review EDUCATION CONSORTIUM OF CENTRAL LA (ECCLA) accounting records. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ADMINISTERS ONE OF THE NATION'S LARGEST FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AWARDING $440 MILLION IN AID TO OVER TWO-THIRDS OF OUR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS. WE WILL MEET THE FULL USC-DETERMINED FINANCIAL NEED OF ALL ADMITTED UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WHO MEET ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND UNIVERSITY ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND DEADLINES. STUDENTS AND THEIR PARENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT ALL APPLICATIONS AND SUPPORT DOCUMENTS, MEETING ALL DEADLINES, IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR CLAIM FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND TO BE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. PART II THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ADMINISTERS SUB-AWARDS FOR RESEARCH TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA DOES NOT REPORT THESE SUB-AWARDS AS GRANTS ON FORM 990, SCHEDULE I SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY. PART III, COLUMN(C) THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

GRANT SUBSTANTIATION THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND METHODOLOGIES FOR DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. FOR MERIT-BASED GRANTS, THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS THE GRANTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STIPULATIONS OF THE UNDERLYING GOVERNING INSTRUMENT (I.E. DONOR ENDOWMENT AGREEMENTS, AND OTHER DONOR DOCUMENTATION). THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS OF COMPLIANCE FOR ALL GRANTS DISPERSED. ASSISTANCE TO MOREHOUSE COLLEGE STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF AIDING WITH THE COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY, I.E. FOR TUITION, HOUSING, AND MEALS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, NEED, AND OTHER DONOR REQUIREMENTS SUCH AS LOCATION OF RESIDENCE. MOREHOUSE COLLEGE HAS CRITERIA FOR THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS NEEDED TO AWARD A SCHOLARSHIP.

Need Scholarships: Manhattan College awards grants-in-aid to accepted students who demonstrate financial need. These awards are renewed annually and adjusted in line with changes on the FAFSA. These awards are given for a maximum of four years (eight semesters). Grant recipients must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Full time enrollment is necessary to receive grant. Academic Scholarships: Eligibility is based on exceptional SAT or ACT scores, secondary school grade point average, and rank in class. The amount of the Scholarship is determined at the time of admission and is offered for four years (eight semesters maximum) provided the student remains eligible. Athletic Scholarships: Manhattan College has available a strictly-budgeted fund to offer grants-in-aid to students who, by the possession of certain athletic skills can add to the community spirit and morale of the campus. The College firmly states that recipients must come to Manhattan as students, with their first interest in studies. They must meet the same entrance requirements as other students and must maintain satisfactory academic progress. Manhattan adheres to and endorses the principles and policies of the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference, Eastern College Athletic Conference and the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Graduate Scholarships are awarded as part of grants, grad assistance or by departments. HEOP Scholarships are awarded as part of the New York State Program. Endowment scholarships are awarded based upon the donors written restrictions.

FOR GRANTS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE, GRANTS ARE CONTROLLED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONSIBLE PERSON ON CAMPUS, WHO IS TYPICALLY THE PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR THE GRANT. ALL PROPOSED EXPENDITURES FROM THE GRANT MUST BE APPROVED BY THAT PERSON. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE INVOICE FOR APPROPRIATENESS WITH THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, REVIEWS THE ACTUAL TRANSACTION TO MAKE SURE THAT IT IS ADEQUATELY SUPPORTED, AND REVIEWS THE TRANSACTION TO BE SURE THAT IT IS AN ALLOWABLE EXPENSE UNDER FEDERAL LAW. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED ITS OWN SET OF GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS TO SEGREGATE THE EXPENSES AND GRANT INCOME FROM OTHER EXPENDITURES AND REVENUES OF THE COLLEGE. IF THE GRANT IS A REIMBURSEMENT GRANT, THE COLLEGE PERIODICALLY DRAWS FUNDS DOWN FROM THE GRANTOR BASED ON THE ACTUAL EXPENSES INCURRED. WHEN REPORTS ARE DUE TO THE GOVERNMENT OR OTHER GRANTOR, THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON PREPARES THE REPORT WITH ASSISTANCE OF THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT. TYPICALLY, THESE REPORTS ARE SIGNED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PERSON AND THE CFO OR PRESIDENT OF THE COLLEGE CERTIFYING THE ACCURACY OF THE REPORT. GRANTS SHOWN ON PART III ARE SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED IN TWO FORMS. FIRST, SOME SCHOLARSHIPS ARE FUNDED BY DONOR GIFTS OR INVESTMENT INCOME FROM DONOR GIFTS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MUST BE GRANTED AS THE DONOR HAS SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT. THE STUDENT MUST MEET THE DESIGNATED REQUIREMENTS OF THE DONOR. SECOND, THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS FROM GENERAL COLLEGE REVENUES. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEEDS WHICH IS CONSISTENT WITH INDUSTRY STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED GRANTS, WORK-STUDY AND STUDENT LOANS. ELIGIBILITY FOR FINANCIAL AID VARIES BASED ON THE CRITERIA OF EACH AWARD. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT SUCH AS HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGE, SAT OR ACT SCORE AND CLASS RANK, AND/OR EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES AND RECOMMENDATIONS. NEED-BASED GRANTS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND AN EMMANUEL COLLEGE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AND WHO, BASED ON THIS INFORMATION, MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE GRANT OR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP. ALL FIRST-YEAR STUDENTS WHO QUALIFY FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND ALL OTHER STUDENTS WHO ARE SELECTED FOR VERIFICATION BY THE CENTRAL PROCESSING SYSTEM (CPS) MUST ALSO SUBMIT VERIFICATION OF THE INFORMATION PROVIDED ON THE FAFSA. NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDE THE FEDERAL PELL GRANT AND FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT (SEOG), THE FEDERAL ACADEMIC COMPETITIVENESS GRANT, THE FEDERAL SMART GRANT, STATE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, AND EMMANUEL COLLEGE GRANT AID. IN ADDITION TO NEED-BASED GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS WHO APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID AND DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED MAY ALSO RECEIVE FEDERAL WORK STUDY AND NEED-BASED FEDERAL AND STATE STUDENT LOANS. THE LOAN PROGRAMS OFFERED BY EMMANUEL COLLEGE ARE THE FEDERAL STAFFORD LOAN, THE FEDERAL PERKINS LOAN AND THE MASSACHUSETTS NO-INTEREST LOAN. PRIOR TO DISBURSING ANY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH GRANT, SCHOLARSHIP, WORK-PROGRAM OR STUDENT LOAN IS CERTIFIED. TO RECEIVE NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID EACH ACADEMIC YEAR.

Grants are made and monitored in accordance with Federal and institutional financial aid policies. Amounts are applied to student accounts as credits to the bill at the Bursar's office to offset academic charges.

EACH ACADEMIC YEAR THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT PROVIDES THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID A DETAILED LIST OF THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS, ALONG WITH THE CURRENT MARKET VALUE OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP, AND STATED CRITERIA RESTRICTIONS, IF ANY, REQUIRED FOR RECIPIENTS OF THOSE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, FROM THAT LIST PROVIDED BY THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL AID, MATCHES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE INSTITUTIONAL AID WITH THOSE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE. THE LIST OF MATCHES IS THEN RETURNED TO THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

WITH RESPECT TO SPONSORED PROJECT ACTIVITY SUBCONTRACTED TO OTHER ENTITIES, THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY AND PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANTS ARE INTENDED TO ESTABLISH APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MECHANISMS TO PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENSURE THAT THE UNIVERSITY AND ITS SPONSORS RECEIVE VALUE FOR FUNDS EXPENDED. THESE PROCEDURES INCLUDE A FORMAL APPROVAL PROCESS FOR SUBAWARDS, PRE-AWARD AND POST-AWARD MONITORING OF SUB RECIPIENTS TO REVIEW THE FINANCIAL STATUS AND MANAGEMENT CONTROLS, COMPLIANCE CERTIFICATIONS RELATIVE TO THE USE OF HUMAN SUBJECTS AND ANIMALS, AND REQUIRED DISCLOSURE OF ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A SUB RECIPIENT ENTITY AND A REVIEW OF PERTINENT OTHER ORGANIZATION INFORMATION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THESE PROCEDURES, THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS THE SUB RECIPIENT'S ADMINISTRATION, BILLINGS AND SCIENTIFIC PROGRESS OF AN ACTIVE SUBAWARD AND CONDUCTS ON-GOING RISK ASSESSMENTS AS WELL AS QUARTERLY QUALITY ASSURANCE REVIEWS ON RANDOMLY SELECTED SUBAWARDS. THE PROCEDURES SERVE TO ENSURE THAT THE SUBAWARDS ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND NOT DIVERTED FROM THEIR INTENDED USE. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH MANY FELLOWSHIP OPPORTUNITIES TO FUND RESEARCH, INDEPENDENT PROJECTS, INTERNSHIPS, VOLUNTEER WORK, COMMUNITY SERVICE, AND STUDY ABROAD. AWARD RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON AN APPLICATION, INCLUDING A PROPOSAL, ESSAYS, BUDGET, ACADEMIC RECORD, AND INTERVIEW, AS APPLICABLE. IN MOST CASES, THE TERMS OF THE AWARD REQUIRE THAT THE RECIPIENT PREPARE AND PRESENT A REPORT OF THE FELLOWSHIP ACTIVITY. FURTHER, CERTAIN FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO DOCUMENT EXPENSES TO VERIFY THAT THE FELLOWSHIP WAS USED FOR THE PURPOSE INTENDED. SUCH DOCUMENTATION MAY INCLUDE COPIES OF PLANE TICKETS AND BOARDING PASSES, COPIES OF VISAS, RECEIPTS FOR TUITION, LETTERS FROM ORGANIZATIONS VERIFYING THE INTERNSHIP AND DATES, ETC., AS APPROPRIATE.
A SUBAWARD IS AN AWARD FROM THE UNIVERSITY TO A QUALIFIED THIRD PARTY PRIMARILY TO PERFORM RESEARCH AND OTHER RELATED PROGRAMMATIC EFFORTS UNDER A SPONSORED RESEARCH PROJECT.

THE AMOUNTS REPORTED IN PART III REPRESENT AN ESTIMATE OF TOTAL AWARDS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2014 BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL SCHOOLS. SOME STUDENTS RECEIVED MORE THAN ONE AWARD DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2014.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Organization's Procedures for Monitoring the Use of Grants:
ExplntnTxt: Form 990, Schedule I, PART I, LINE 2 THE COlLEGE HAS DESIGNED AND IMPLEMENTED INTERNAL CONTROLS THAT INCLUDE FINANCIAL REPORTING AS WELL AS INTERNAL CONTROL OVER COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS AND GRANT AGREEMENTS. INCLUDED IN THE INTERNAL CONTROL STRUCTURE IS A COMPREHENSIVE GRANTS AND CONTRACTS POLICY THAT PROVIDES THE ECKERD COLLEGE COMMUNITY GUIDELINES FOR GRANTS RECORDKEEPING, REPORTING AND MANAGEMENT. THE FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS OFFICES HAVE PRIMARY ROLES IN THE MONITORING OF GRANT FUNDS WHICH INCLUDES PROCEDURES FOR FINANCIAL REPORTING, FUNDS REQUESTS, INVOICING, REIMBURSEMENTS, PROGRAM ACTIVITY OVERSIGHT, PURCHASES, CLOSE OUT AND POST AWARD COMPLIANCE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE COMMUNICATES DIRECTLY AND FREQUENTLY WITH FACULTY AND STAFF MEMBERS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL COLLEGE POLICIES. THE COLLEGE IS ALSO SUBJECT TO EXTERNAL AUDITS WHICH ARE PERFORMED AT LEAST ANNUALLY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE AMOUNTS, ELIGIBILITY, AND SELECTION CRITERIA USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE ASSISTANCE BY REVIEWING GRADE TRANSCRIPTS AND ATTENDANCE RECORDS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE SCHOOL REQUIRES THE STUDENTS TO PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION OF THE EXPENSES PRIOR TO RECEIVING FUNDS.
THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO A NUMBER OF ITS STUDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO ATTEND SCHOOL. THE RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED USING A NEED BASED CRITERIA.

Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation provides the assistance as part of its program services activity. All scholarships are provided to individuals and monitored through the Graduate School of Addiction Studies, the Professionals in Residence training program and the Community Relations department to ensure the monies are used for the purpose intended. The tuition paid for those programs and the funds given to assist with the tuition is tracked by each individual.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS ARE PROVIDED IN THE FORM OF STIPENDS TO RESIDENTS, POST-DOCTORAL, AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. THE STIPENDS ARE SUBJECT TO ALL OF THE PAYROLL SYSTEM CONTROLS, TIME SHEETS, TIME AND EFFORT REPORTING AND OTHER PAYROLL CONTROLS. THE REMAINING GRANTS USE TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS WHICH ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO WHICH THE STUDENT HAS NO ACCESS.

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION CRITERIA. THE FINANCE OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS.

THE SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED BY ADRIAN COLLEGE ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AND FEE CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE SCHOOL IS ALSO ABLE TO MONITOR WHETHER STUDENTS REMAIN AT THE COLLEGE THROUGH THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE, THE VICE PRESIDENT AND DEAN OF ACADEMIC AFFAIRS' OFFICE, CLASS ATTENDANCE TAKEN BY PROFESSORS, AND HOUSING RECORDS MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT AFFAIRS'OFFICE
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED EACH YEAR BY FINANCIAL AID IN CONJUNCTION/CONSULTATION WITH THE ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT.

THE AMOUNT OF FUNDS DISTRIBUTED IS COMPARED WITH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO INSURE A BALANCE OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED IS EVALUATED TO INSURE STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE AN OVER AWARD ACCORDING TO THE GUIDELINES OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS CONCERNING GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND COMPLETED NUMBER OF COURSES ONCE A YEAR.

THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ISSUES AND MONITORS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS. THE FINANCE DIVISION MONITORS THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS REFLECTED ON STUDENT BILLING. STUDENT AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES. STUDENT AID IS AWARDED BASED ON MEETING ESTABLISHED CRITERIA WHICH INCLUDE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The College's procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds requires verification of 1) enrollment status, 2) number of hours enrolled, 3) number of earned credit hours, 4) GPA, and 5) housing status. In addition, a review of student academic performance and grades of incomplete, if applcable, is conducted each semester to determine overall standing in relation to College's established Satisfactory Academic Policy (SAP).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, TALENT, LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON UNIVERSITY HERITAGE AND MISSION. THIS IS PRIMARILY FROM THE APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION, TRANSCRIPTS AND TEST SCORES, BUT MAY ALSO INCLUDE AUDITIONS AND TRY-OUTS. AWARDS WITH SPECIFIC RENEWAL CRITERIA ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL SERVICES.

College funded scholarships and grants as well as scholarships and grants from restricted sources (need and non need based) provided to students of the four schools of the College. The scholarships are credited to student accounts and are monitored through the financial aid office in conjunction with the controller's office
Financial aid department maintains records to substantiate all amounts given in financial aid.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the Financial Aid Office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depends on other factors such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required OMB A-133 audit annually.

NATIONAL UNIVERSITY INTERNATIONAL IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS RELATED TO EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY PURPOSES TO PROMOTE STEM SUBJECT AREAS. RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE THROUGH PERIODIC REPORTS AND STUDENT RECORDS.

BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES, AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.

CONCORDIA UNIVERSITY IRVINE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS ACCOUNTABLE FOR MONITORING AND DISBURSING ALL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS AND MATCHES THE REQUIREMENTS TO THE RECIPIENT. FOR GRANTS, A DIRECTOR FOR THE GRANT AUTHORIZES EXPENDITURES. FOR GOVERNMENT GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS THE GOVERNMENT'S "DO NOT USE-VENDOR LIST" TO QUALIFY PROSPECTIVE VENDORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR THE ADLER-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIP, STUDENTS MUST HAVE APPLIED FOR ADMISSION TO THE SCHOOL. ADMISSION SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RESERVED FOR FULL-TIME U.S. OR CANADIAN STUDENTS. TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY, STUDENTS MUST SHOW SATISFACTORY PROGRESS AND A GPA OF 3.25 IN PSYCHOLOGY COURSEWORK AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION. ADDITIONALLY, ADLER ALSO GRANTS SCHOLARSHIPS TO EMPLOYEES PURSUING DEGREE PROGRAMS. TO QUALIFY, EMPLOYEES HAVE TO OBTAIN PRIOR MANAGER'S APPROVAL. THEY RECEIVE UP TO 6 CREDIT HOURS OF SCHOLARSHIP EACH SEMESTER. RELATIVES OF FACULTY MEMBERS AND THE SCHOOL FOUNDERS ARE ALSO ELIGIBLE FOR THE SAME TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHOSE STAFF IS TRAINED AND CONTINUOUSLY EDUCATED REGARDING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT CAN BE AWARDED TO THE STUDENT BASED ON FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF ALSO AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ENDOWED GIFTS THAT COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE ENDOWED GIFTS.
HALLMARK MAKES GRANTS TO WORTHY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE THE SAME BELIEFS AS THE UNIVERSITY.

EACH STUDENT IS REVIEWED BY TWO OR THREE INDIVIDUALS IN THE AWARDING PROCESS. STUDENTS ARE THEN AWARDED GRANT FUNDS BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS, GUIDELINES AND INSTITUTIONAL MATRIX. PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING FUNDS ARE ALSO BUILT INTO THE COMPUTER AWARDING SOFTWARE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TJU monitors subrecipients by reviewing financial and performance reports submitted by the subrecipient and regular contact with the subrecipient and inquiries concerning programmatic activities, including quarterly certifications by principal investigators that work is progressing according to scope and that deliverables are being met.

ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS MADE BY CENTRAL CHRISTIAN COLLEGE IN KANSAS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE UNDER THE GUIDELINES AND REGULATIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. ALL SUCH GRANTS, AWARDS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS APPEAR ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD LETTERS THAT ARE SIGNED BY THE STUDENT RECIPIENTS. THESE SAME GRANTS AND AWARDS CAN BE TRACED DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AND ON THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING SYSTEM.
All grant aid is to enrolled students at Shimer College. Each student is required to file a FAFSA in accordance with Federal Guidelines.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Process for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds in the United States:
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Thunderbird awards scholarships to competitive applicants who demonstrate a high level of academic credentials and evidence that they meet specific criteria associated with a specific award. Thunderbird awards scholarships to students from every continent of the world.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO ALL STUDENTS MEETING THE WRITTEN CRITERIA
FOR THE AWARD OF THE SCHOLARSHIP. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS ARE
AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT BASED ON ESTABLISHED POLICIES.

VANGUARD UNIVERSITY AWARDS MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATES AND MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO GRADUATE STUDENTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING ACADEMIC, TALENT AND PARTICIPATION, AND INCENTIVE INCLUDING DENOMINATION, MINISTRY/MISSIONARY DEPENDENT. CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY INCLUDING MAINTENANCE GPA IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. NEED-BASED AWARDS REQUIRE DEMONSTRATED NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA AND REQUIRES FILING THE FAFSA BY THE MARCH 2 PRIORITY DEADLINE EACH YEAR AND CONTINUED DEMONSTRATION OF NEED. THE MAJORITY OF THE AWARDS ARE FUNDED BY THE INSTITUTIONAL AID BUDGET BUT SMALL NUMBER ARE FUNDED BY THE ENDOWMENT AND HAVE DONOR SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH UNIVERSITY ADVANCEMENT AND FISCAL MANAGEMENT TO AWARD THESE FUNDS.

The University follows guidelines set by the Department of Education, and State Governments, to ensure that grants to students are awarded to eligible recipients. All documentation regarding the awarding of these grants is maintained in the student file.

Scholarships and tuition discounts are awarded to students on an individual basis. Awards are based on demonstrated financial need, academic preparation, and mission compatability of the student. The financial aid department has primary responsibility for evaluating students for awards but collaborates with a wider range of colleagues throughout the institution.

The Business office reviews the recipient's Form 990 and A-133 audit report if available. The Director of the program at VLS works closely with the recipient of the funds that will be paid by the grant to coordinate activities/training essential for program effectiveness. The recipient submits invoices to VLS which are reviewed and approved by the Program Director to substantiate the grant related purpose. The invoice is then forwarded to the business office for review and coding to the proper accounts. The funds are then forwarded to the recipient. If deemed necessary, VLS may carry out an on site monitoring visit for general training, reviewing of the recipient's procedures/records and informing the recipient of grant requirements.

The organization uses congressional methodology from the U.S. Department of Education need analysis. It assigns student eligibility based on effective family contribution from the Pell Processing Center. All records on packaging as well as awarding are processed through the organization's PowerFAIDS system.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS USED FOR TUITION AND FEES.

EXPENDITURE REQUESTS ARE INITIATED AT THE DEPARTMENT LEVEL (I.E. THE PI, OR THEIR DESIGNEE REQUESTS THAT THEIR DEPARTMENT MAKE A PURCHASE ON THEIR BEHALF). EXPENDITURE REQUESTS ARE SUBMITTED IN WRITING EITHER BY USING A PURCHASE ORDER, CHECK REQUEST, TRAVEL VOUCHER, OR, ON RARE OCCASIONS, A MEMO. TO PRECLUDE INCURRING OBLIGATIONS IN EXCESS OF TOTAL FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR THE AWARD THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS ALL EXPENDITURE REQUESTS, PRIOR TO BEING INCURRED, TO ENSURE THAT THERE IS ADEQUATE BUDGET AVAILABLE FOR THE PURCHASE. THE GRANT ACCOUNTANT IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW GRANT BUDGETS PERIODICALLY. THE GRANT ACCOUNTANT REVIEWS THE EXPENDITURE REQUESTS TO ENSURE THAT NO BUDGET CATEGORIES ARE OVERRUN AND REVIEWS THE EXPENSE LIST FOR ANY UNUSUAL ACTIVITY. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS AWARD-RELATED EXPENDITURE REQUESTS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH OMB COST PRINCIPLES. RECONCILIATIONS ARE PREPARED BY THE GRANT ACCOUNTANT FOR MAJOR GRANTS AND ARE REVIEWED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FISCAL AFFAIRS AND CONTROLLER.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE AND ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION COSTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS IN ORDER TO ENSURE THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, AND LOANS BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL FAFSA APPLICATIONS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE COLLEGE ARE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL AUDITS BY INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Student aid is based on academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. The College evaluates student eligibility at the end of each semester for the following term and also before disbursement of financial aid.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART II, LINE 1(A):
ExplntnTxt: BOYS & GIRLS CLUB SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO CLUB MEMBERS WHO ARE ATTENDING COLLEGE AT ANY NUMBER OF UNIVERSITIES. THE PAYMENTS ARE EITHER ONCE A YEAR OR TWICE A YEAR DEPENDING ON THE AMOUNT OF THE SCHOLARSHIP. CLUB MEMBERS SEND IN DOCUMENTATION SHOWING ANY BALANCE ON THEIR ACCOUNTS AND WE PAY OUT AMOUNTS BASED ON HOW THE SCHOLARSHIP WAS AWARDED. SOME STUDENTS ARE GIVEN STRAIGHTFORWARD AMOUNTS LIKE $1000 PER YEAR FOR FOUR YEARS AND OTHERS ARE GIVEN 1/2 OF OUTSTANDING BALANCE AFTER ALL OTHER GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS UP TO $5000 FOR FOUR YEARS, STILL ANOTHER IS GIVEN UP TO $2000 PER YEAR TO COVER TEXTBOOKS ONLY. THIS IS ALL OUTLINED IN A SPREADSHEET WHERE PAYMENTS ARE TRACKED AND COPIES OF ALL DOCUMENTATION, LETTERS TO THEIR SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND COPIES OF THE CHECKS ARE KEPT ON FILE.

HERZING EDUCATIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS AT HERZING UNIVERSITY THREE TIMES PER YEAR, COORDINATING WITH THE SCHOOL'S SEMESTERS. THE AWARDS ARE PRORATED BASED ON HOW MANY SEMESTERS REMAIN IN THE FISCAL YEAR. FOR INSTANCE IF A STUDENT IS AWARDED $3000 IN THE SPRING SEMESTER THEY ARE AWARDED $1000 AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SPRING, SUMMER, AND FALL SEMESTERS, IF THEY ARE AWARDED $3000 IN THE SUMMER SEMESTER THEY WOULD BE GIVEN $1500 AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SUMMER AND FALL SEMESTERS. MONEY IS PAID DIRECTLY TO THE SCHOOL AND POSTED DIRECTLY TO THEIR TUITION ACCOUNTS. BEFORE ANY SEMESTER DISBURSEMENT IS MADE THE STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED, MAKING SURE THEY HAVEN'T ELECTED TO TAKE STIPENDS AND THAT THEIR GPA AND SCHOOL ENROLLMENT STATUS STILL QUALIFIES THEM FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP. SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENT'S INFO, PAYMENTS DUE/MADE, AND NOTES ARE KEPT IN A SPREADSHEET FOR EACH AWARDING YEAR AND COPIES OF THE CHECKS AND LETTERS TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ARE KEPT ON FILE.

The University awards grants, scholarships & student loans based on various, predefined criteria. Students must qualify for the assistance. Student enrollment and continuing eligibility are verified on an ongoing basis. Any amounts in excess of $600.00 are reported on Form 1098-T.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID, DEVELOPMENT, AND BUSINESS OFFICES TOGETHER ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. THREE DIFFERENT OFFICES ARE INVOLVED IN THE PROCESS FOR ADEQUATE CHECKS AND BALANCES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE VERIFIES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANTS AND AWARDS THE GRANT FUNDS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE CLOSELY MONITORS THE RESTRICTIONS PLACED ON THE GRANT FUNDS FROM THIRD PARTIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE GRANTEES SELECTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FULFILL THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER THE RESTRICTIONS ON THESE GRANTS. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE USES INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ASSIST WITH THIS PROCESS. THESE INTERNAL REPORTS PROVIDE BASIC DATA ON STUDENT ELIGIBILITY, SUCH AS MAJOR, GPA, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE REPORTS BACK TO THE APPROPRIATE GRANTORS CONCERNING THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE POSTS THE DISBURSEMENT OF THE GRANT FUNDS TO THE GENERAL LEDGER UPON RECEIVING CONFIRMATION FROM THE FINANCIAL AID AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICES. ALL GRANT INFORMATION IS KEPT ON A SECURE DATABASE. THIS DATABASE INCLUDES THE NAMES OF THE STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS, THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANTS, THE CRITERIA USED TO AWARD GRANTS, AND THE APPLICABLE SEMESTER AND ACADEMIC YEAR.

Grants are made and monitored in accordance with Federal and institutional financial aid policies. Amounts are applied to student accounts as credits to the bill at the Bursar's office to offset academic charges.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED VIA A REDUCTION IN TUITION.

THE UNIVERSITY FOUNDATION HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE GRANT FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED PROPERLY. FURTHERMORE, THE FOUNDATION IS AUDITED ANNUALLY BY AN INDEPENDENT FIRM AND TRI-ANNUALLY BY THE CHANCELLOR'S OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THESE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

FOR FEDERAL AND PASS-THROUGH GRANTS FOR PROGRAMS, EACH GRANT HAS A GRANT MANAGER. ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILES EXPENSES INCURRED FOR EACH GRANT AND VERIFIES WITH THE RESPECTIVE GRANT MANAGER. ONCE CONFIRMED, THE BUSINESS OFFICE REQUESTS REIMBURSEMENT FROM THE RESPECTIVE AWARDING AGENCY. FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FINANCIAL AID REVIEWS THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR AWARDING TO STUDENTS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE DOES A RECONCILIATION OF EXPENSES (FINANCIAL AID AWARDED) BEFORE DRAWING DOWN ACTUAL DOLLARS FROM THE ENDOWMENT (BOTH THE UNIVERSITY OF SIOUX FALLS AND THE UNIVERSITY OF SIOUX FALLS FOUNDATION) AND FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. FOR PROGRAMS, THERE ARE TWO DIFFERENT METHODS USED. SOME PROGRAMS HAVE "BUDGET MANAGERS" WHO ARE AWARE OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE VIA THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND SPEND ACCORDINGLY. FOR THOSE PROGRAMS WITHOUT "BUDGET MANAGERS" AND FOR UNRESTRICTED ENDOWMENTS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE ENSURES THAT THERE ARE EXPENSES INCURRED IN THOSE SPECIFIC DEPARTMENTS BEFORE DRAWING DOWN ACTUAL DOLLARS. IN ALL CASES FOR THE ENDOWMENTS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE DOES A RECONCILIATION TO ENSURE THAT THE PROPER DOLLAR AMOUNT IS CALCULATED, AWARDED/EXPENSED, AND DRAWN DOWN.
THE COLLEGE HAS A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FUNDS AVAILABLE EACH YEAR TO BE USED
FOR STUDENT AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. EACH SCHOLARSHIP HAS CLEARLY
DEFINED ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. SOME SCHOLARSHIPS SUCH AS ACADEMIC
MERIT ARE AUTOMATICALLY AWARDED IF ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE MET. IN
OTHER CASES STUDENTS MAKE APPLICATIONS FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP THEY WISH
TO BE CONSIDERED. THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE SCHOLARSHIP
APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT WITHIN 14 DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

JOHN F KENNEDY UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE GRANTEES AS PER REGULATIONS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. GRANT FUNDS AND GRANTEES ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE PER REGULATIONS THROUGH PERIODIC AND ANNUAL REPORTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
