ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. PERSONNEL REVIEW STUDENT NEED ON A YEARLY BASIS AND AWARD GRANTS BASED ON NEED AND ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY KANSAS CITY ART INSTITUTE.

THE UNIVERSITY'S USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL AID TO OUR STUDENTS. WE MONITOR THE USE OF THESE UNIVERSITY FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED LEVELS OF AWARDS BASED ON A STUDENT'S MERIT CLASSIFICATION AND ON AN ANNUAL BUDGET. THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHICH IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: AFTER STUDENT HAS BEEN ACCEPTED, THEY MUST FILE A FAFSA. HUNTINGTON CONSIDERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS, OUTSIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FEDERAL GRANTS AND STATE ELIGIBILITY IN THAT RESPECTIVE ORDER. IF THE STUDENT NEEDS FURTHER ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FEDERAL LOANS, COLLEGE GRANTS AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED IS AWARDED ON FAFSA CALCULATIONS AND THE RESULTING FINANCIAL AID THAT IS TO BE MET. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GPA, CLASS RANK AND STANDARD TEST SCORES. NEED-BASED GRANTS CAN BE ALLOCATED TO RETURNING STUDENTS BASED ON PREVIOUS YEARS AS LONG AS FINANCIAL NEED IS STILL PRESENT. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS CONTINUE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GPA AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The University manages an extensive financial assistance program to ensure that a highly qualified and diverse population is able to matriculate and continue to graduation. The assistance programs take three major forms: merit scholarships, need-based financial aid, and financing alternatives. The student first applies for assistance, and then based on the grant criteria (financial and enrollment), the financial aid department awards the grant monies. The financial aid department monitors the total amounts given by grant.
The University follows the federal, state or local guidelines for any
financial aid grants. The University uses the federal methodology to
determine awards. In the University's case, whoever the grant is for, a
particular person, is responsible for the proper spending. The University
checks that the grants stay within their amounts and purpose on a periodic basis.

MERCY MEDICAL CENTER CONTRIBUTED $80,000 TO MARYLAND MATERNITY ACCESS COALITION, INC., A SECTION 501(C)(4) ORGANIZATION THAT IS ORGANIZED AND OPERATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR SOCIAL WELFARE PURPOSES. THE COALITION PUBLICLY ADVOCATES FOR AND SUPPORTS LEGISLATION, REGULATIONS, AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MAINTAIN AND ENHANCE HEALTH CARE ACCESS FOR MARYLAND MOTHERS AND BABIES. THE PURPOSE OF THE CONTRIBUTION WAS TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE COALITION INCLUDING ITS PUBLIC EDUCATION AND ADVOCACY EFFORTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS ARE REVIEWED AND MONITORED BY THE GRANTS MANAGER. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A GRANT ADMINISTRATOR WHO COORDINATES GRANT COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANTS MANAGER. GRANT REIMBURSEMENTS ARE RECEIVED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL OPERATIONS DEPARTMENT. GRANT EXPENDITURES REQUIRE THE SAME APPROVAL AS NON-GRANT EXPENDITURES THROUGH THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE APPROVAL MATRIX. ALL PERIODIC REPORTS TO THE GRANTING AGENCY FOR GRANTS THAT REQUIRE THIS ARE FILED TIMELY WITH THE APPROPRIATE AGENCY. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION UNDERGOES A FEDERAL A-133 GRANT AUDIT ANNUALLY BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Monitoring the use of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Furman provides scholarships and financial aid to individuals in the United States to attend the university. The scholarships and aid for such students are awarded based on need and merit and cover the costs of tuition, room and board. The scholarship and/or financial aid is awarded based on institutional policy and standards set forth by the US Department of Education and the State of South Carolina. The University's Financial Aid Department monitors the compliance with such regulations. The scholarship and/or financial aid is applied by the Financial Aid Department directly against the student's account with the University as a reduction in fees. As a result, the grant can only be used for its intended purpose (i.e. cost of attendance) and can not be diverted from this use. Other types of grants provided consist of research, internship or fellowship grants to students. Such grants are given and monitored by the academic department giving the grant or the Undergraduate Research and Internship Department.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH AN INSTITUTIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE DATABASE IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS AND POLICIES.

The college maintains records to ensure direct loans are awarded to eligible students in compliance with federal financial aid regulations, or donor restrictions for externally funded scholarships or college criteria for internally funded scholarships.

Goucher College's grant funds are limited to need-based and merit-based financial assistance for attendance at the college. Goucher College's comprehensive program of need-based and merit-based financial assistance is managed by the Office of Student Financial Aid. As a member of the College Board and in keeping with the principles and practices of the College Scholarship Service, financial aid is awarded to properly qualified candidates on the basis of the financial need of students and their families. Financial need is determined by subtracting the Expected Family Contribution - as calculated on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and the Profile Form of the College Scholarship Service - from the student's total cost of attendance. Financial aid is awarded for one year only and must be renewed annually. Need-based aid is renewed to continuing students who demonstrate need and who are making satisfactory progress toward their degrees. Institutional merit-based scholarship requirements vary depending on the award. Compliance with those requirements are also overseen by the Office of Student Financial Aid.

The College provides individual scholarship assistance to enrolled students to defray the costs of college attendance. This assistance is directly credited to the student's billing account ensuring that the funds are used in accordance with the regulations. In instances of donor stipulations, the eligibility of the recipient is monitored by the financial aid office and the business office monitors the award amounts.

DISBURSEMENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE INSTITUTION'S EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROCEDURES OR SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE INSTITUTION'S GOVERNING BOARD DESIGNED TO INSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS FROM THIS ORGANIZATION IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS EXEMPT PROGRAMS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS AS TO ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarship amounts are paid based on a comprehensive application process.

ALL GRANTS REPORTED IN PART III OF SCHEDULE I ARE TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR COSTS OF ATTENDANCE. GRANTS ARE ELECTRONICALLY TRANSMITTED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID INTO THE ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE SYSTEM OF THE BUSINESS OFFICE BASED UPON SYSTEM IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS FOR INDIVIDUALS. EACH STUDENT IS ABLE TO COMPARE THE AID POSTED AGAINST HIS BILLING STATEMENT FOR TUITION AND FEES TO THE AWARD LETTER HE RECEIVED FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. ADDITIONALLY, DURING THE COLLEGE'S ANNUAL AUDIT, THIS PROCESS IS TESTED FOR ACCURACY NOT ONLY OF AMOUNTS AND ASSIGNMENT TO CORRECT INDIVIDUALS, BUT ALSO FOR ANY RESTRICTIONS OF GRANT FUNDING REGARDING AWARDEE ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED TO QUALIFY FOR ANY PARTICULAR AWARD. LINE THREE IN PART III REPORTS THE FEDERALLY FUNDED SUPPLEMENTAL GRANTS; THE COLLEGE ANNUALLY CONTRACTS FOR AN AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED THROUGH OUR FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Students requesting financial aid are screened for financial need, academic merit, and other scholarship criteria prior to the awarding of scholarships. The combined total of scholarships, grants and other tuition related awards may not exceed the cost of tuition. Students must meet the enrollment guidelines and maintain satisfactory academic progress to retain awards received. Monitoring of these criteria is a combined effort of the Financial Aid office, the Registrar's office and the Business office.

The Federal and State funds provided for financial aid to students of Rose-Hulman follows all regulations. Each year the regulations are evaluated to verify that all regulations are being followed based on each funds criteria.

Stipends and research fellowships are funds paid to offset living expenses for trainees while they further their education at Rockefeller. These amounts are not considered salary or wages given in consideration for specific job duties nor are they grants given in anticipation of specific scientific achievements on the individuals parts. There is no restriction on the use of the funds once they are received by the trainees.
Grants were made only for tax-exempt purposes.

Grant disbursements for the institution's exempt programs are made in accordance with the exempt purpose for which the institution was organized, and with procedures and conditions established by the institution's governing board. Student scholarships and grants are awarded based on the institution's assessment of recipient's academic achievement, financial need, and other standards similar to those held by other universities. The student's records are then monitored in order to ensure that the grant requirements are continuing to be met.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED AND ABILITY. BOTH ARE BASED ON SET CRITERIA. THE CRITERIA FOR NEED BASED GRANTS IS BASED ON FEDERAL NEED LEVELS SUCH AS PELL ELIGIBILITY. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THE STRENGTH OF THE STUDENT'S PORTFOLIO.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED AND IS APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING EACH STUDENT'S CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND OTHER MERIT BASED CRITERIA ALONG WITH A COMPLETED APPLICATION FOR STUDENT FEDERAL AID AND DETERMINES WHETHER A NEED LEVEL IS SUBSTANTIATED BY THE APPLICATION. THE AID AND ASSISTANCE PAYS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, AND BOOKSTORE CHARGES.

A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY OF EACH STUDENT WHO APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID, USING FORMULAS AND CRITERIA PROMULGATED BY VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL BODIES, AS WELL AS MARYWOOD'S INTERNALLY ESTABLISHED RULES AND PROCEDURES.
THE COLLEGE VERIFIES THAT THE RECIPIENT MEETS THE GUIDELINES OF EACH SPECIFIC AWARD. THE COLLEGE APPLIES GRANT MONIES DIRECTLY TO STUDENT BALANCES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS GRANTS BASED ON NEED TO NEW AND CONTINUING STUDENTS WHO HAVE COMPLETED A FAFSA AND ARE CONSIDERED TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. THE DOCERE AND TOLEE TOTUM GRANT AWARDS ARE FUNDED BY INSTITUTIONAL FUNDRAISING EFFORTS. BOTH AWARDS EMBODY THE SPIRIT OF NATUROPATHIC MEDICINE, WHERE DOCERE IS A "DOCTOR AS TEACHER" AND TOLEE TOTUM IS "TREAT THE WHOLE PERSON". THE ENROLLMENT MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE SERVES AS THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE IN REVIEWING AND DETERMINING THE AWARDS. THE DOCERE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT AND NEED. THE TOLEE TOTUM AWARDS ARE ALSO BASED ON NEED AND AN ESSAY WHERE APPLICANTS IDENTIFY WHAT THE PRACTICE OF NATUROPATHIC MEDICINE MEANS TO THEM AND HOW A GRANT AWARDS WOULD AID THEM IN REACHING THEIR EDUCATIONAL GOALS. WHEN ESTABLISHING THESE GRANT AWARDS, THE ORGANIZATION SEEKS TO REWARD STUDENTS WHO HAVE ACHIEVED HIGH ACADEMIC SUCCESS AS WELL AS THOSE WHO WILL BENEFIT THE MOST FROM THE GRANT AWARD. AS STATED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S COURSE CATALOG, THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, DISABILITY, SEX, RELIGION, AGE, NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, OR MARITAL STATUS IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF EDUCATIONAL AND ADMISSION POLICIES, FINANCIAL AID, EMPLOYMENT OR ANY OTHER PROGRAM OR ACTIVITY. THIS STATEMENT APPLIES TO THE AWARDING OF SCNM SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Monitoring the use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: form 990, Schedule I, part I, Line 2 The College has developed an institutional packaging philosophy to ensure consistent, equitable, and fair distribution of financial aid funds. Packaging parameters are periodically reviewed with the help of an outside consultant, to evaluate the MMC grants and scholarship programs offered to all student populations at MMC.

GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. QUALIFICATIONS INCLUDE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED PER THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FAFSA, AND/OR MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. FAFSA INFORMATION IS ANNUALLY UPDATED. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED FOR GRADE-POINT AVERAGE, PROGRESS TOWARD THE DEGREE OBJECTIVE, AND OTHER SIGNALS OF ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS WHERE THOSE EXIST. THE PROCESS IS MANAGED BY THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICER WHO DETERMINES AMOUNTS, AND A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHO ASSIGNS THE SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS WERE AWARDED TO 145 STUDENTS IN FALL 2013.

Student financial aid is awarded after an application and eligibility verification process, using the FAFSA for establishing financial need, and GPA and recommendations to establish merit. Competitions or other award qualifications are used to determine eligibility where applicable. Records are maintained in our Financial Aid office; scholarships and awards are applied directly to students' accounts.

THE VP OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION STAFF OVERSEE THAT THE PROVISIONS OF THE GRANT ARE MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH GUIDELINES OR AGREEMENTS SET FORTH, WHETHER THAT'S USE OF DONOR, GOVERNMENT OR PRIVATE SOURCES.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ITS STUDENTS WITH VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE AWARDED BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. EACH STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED PRIOR TO AWARDING A SCHOLARSHIP. THE UNIVERSITY POSTS THE GRANT DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENT'S OUTSTANDING ACCOUNT BALANCE TO ENSURE THE PROPER USE OF AWARDED FUNDS.

GRANTS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS BY THE UNIVERSITY OF RICHMOND CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING THESE GRANTS ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY ON THE BASIS OF THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR CRITERIA. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES AND STANDARDS. GRANTS MADE TO ORGANIZATIONS LOCATED IN THE UNITED STATES WERE MADE PURSUANT TO THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR GRANT SUBAWARDS. SUBAWARD ACTIVITY IS MONITORED PRIMARILY BY THE GRANTS ACCOUNTING OFFICE. SUBAWARD DOCUMENTATION, INCLUDING INVOICES, RECEIPTS, PAYMENT REQUESTS, AND SIMILAR RECORDS, IS REVIEWED BY GRANTS ACCOUNTING TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL POLICIES, OMB CIRCULAR A-21, AND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT, AND APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR.
THE UNIVERSITY HAS A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE THAT SELECTS ALL SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: form 990, schedule i, part i, line 2
ExplntnTxt: THE INSTITUTE'S GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE WITHIN THE UNITED STATES CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS ARE SELECTED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS. VARIOUS INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR ELIGIBILITY AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BY GRANTEES. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL $75,000 GRANT TO THE CALTECH Y. IN ADDITION, THE INSTITUTE ALLOWS THE CALTECH Y THE USE OF FACILITIES ON CAMPUS FREE OF CHARGE. THE CALTECH Y IS A RELATED ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE STUDENTS OF CALTECH THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES. TMT DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION COLLABORATES WITH THE INSTITUTE ON THE THIRTY METER TELESCOPE PROJECT. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL DONATION (DESIGNATED ASSISTANCE) TO THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER LOS ANGELES. THE INSTITUTE ALLOWS THE CHILDREN'S CENTER AT CALTECH THE USE OF FACILITIES ON CAMPUS FREE OF CHARGE. THE CHILDREN'S CENTER IS AN UNRELATED NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE CHILD CARE SERVICES TO PARENTS THAT LIVE IN THE VICINITY OF CALTECH OR ARE EMPLOYED BY CALTECH. INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR GRANTEES PERFORMANCE ACCORDING TO THEIR RESPECTIVE PROGRAM SERVICES GOALS AND/OR PURSUANT TO OTHER AGREEMENTS. FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN (C) CASH GRANTS REPRESENT CREDIT ON ACCOUNTS.

The College provides scholarships to students enrolled in its programs. Scholarships are awarded based upon student acheivements in academics and performing arts. To be considered for scholarship assistance, students must apply for admission and submit academic transcripts of prior education work, test scores (ACT/SAT), and an application for the scholarship program. Some scholarships require additional recommendations or certifications by third parties. Academic progress of scholarship recipients is monitored, and recipients must earn both a minimum amount of college credits and a minimum GPA each semester in order to maintain eligibility. The Seed Project Grant was established to foster and develop an entrepreneurial spirit amongst Covenant College students and to create an opportunity for the students to develop real ideas and put them into action. Business plans are submitted by students for initial review by a committee of Covenant College faculty, staff, alumni, and other friends of the College. Once the business plan earns approval, the plan is presented to an independent panel of judges. The College awards the Seed Project Grant after the independent panel declares a winning idea. Recipients provide receipts to demonstrate that funds were used for legitimate and appropriate business expenses, and the College follows up with recipients at six month intervals following the award until the funds are depleted.
STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION SHOWING FINANCIAL NEED. THE STUDENTS MUST USE THE SCHOLARSHIP AT THE CINCINNATI COLLEGE OF MORTUARY SCIENCE AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND LOANS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED (AS DETERMINED BY A STANDARDIZED FINANCIAL AID FORM), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND/OR LEADERSHIP. RECIPIENTS ARE CHOSEN BASED ON OBJECTIVE CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF SEX, RACE, COLOR, OR NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF ITS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS. ANY ESTIMATES UTILIZED ARE BASED ON CALCULATED AVERAGE AWARDS EXTENDED TO COMPARABLE GROUPS. ALL AWARDS ARE DISBURSED DIRECTLY TO THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT TO THE RECIPIENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: BAPTIST MISSIONARY ASSOCIATION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY UTILIZES A SPECIALIZED SOFTWARE PROGRAM TO TRACK THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS. A PROSPECTIVE RECIPIENT APPLIES ONLINE THROUGH A GOVERNMENT WEB SITE WHO THEN SENDS THE INFORMATION TO THE SEMINARY. INFORMATION ON THE APPLICATION IS VERIFIED INTERNALLY AND, BASED ON GUIDELINES IN THE FEDERAL STUDENT FINANCIAL AID HANDBOOK, IT IS DETERMINED THE AMOUNT OF AID THE RECIPIENT QUALIFIES FOR. UPON RECEIPT OF THE FUNDS, PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS ACCOUNT.

To remain at Knox, all degree-seeking students are expected to make satisfactory academic progress. Satisfactory progress is defined both in terms of the accumulation of credits toward the degree, and as the maintenance of a gradepoint average consistent with graduation requirements. The Financial Aid Office follows the decisions of the Academic Standing Committee in determining whether a student is meeting the College's satisfactory academic progress standards.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY REGISTRAR AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR GPA REQUIREMENTS, ENROLLMENT REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER ISSUES. REVIEWS ARE DONE REGULARLY.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPT. OF ED., THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

IN PART AS A RESULT OF ENDOWMENT SUPPORT OF STUDENT AID, STANFORD IS ABLE TO WAIVE THE TOTAL COST OF TUITION FOR MANY OF ITS DESERVING STUDENTS. STANFORD RECENTLY EXPANDED FINANCIAL AID BY INCREASING THE INCOME THRESHOLDS AT WHICH PARENTS ARE NOT EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TOWARD EDUCATIONAL COSTS. STANFORD WILL EXPECT NO PARENTAL CONTRIBUTION TOWARD TUITION FROM PARENTS WITH ANNUAL INCOMES BELOW $125,000 - PREVIOUSLY $100,000 - AND TYPICAL ASSETS. AND THERE WILL BE ZERO PARENTAL CONTRIBUTION TOWARD TUITION, ROOM OR BOARD FOR PARENTS WITH ANNUAL INCOMES BELOW $65,000 - PREVIOUSLY $60,000 - AND TYPICAL ASSETS. THIS EXPANSION OF THE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM IS A DEMONSTRATION OF STANFORD'S COMMITMENT TO ACCESS FOR OUTSTANDING STUDENTS FROM ALL BACKGROUNDS - INCLUDING NOT ONLY THOSE FROM THE LOWEST SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS, BUT ALSO MIDDLE- AND UPPER-MIDDLE-CLASS FAMILIES WHO NEED OUR ASSISTANCE AS WELL. GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS REFLECT NON-COMPENSATORY SUPPORT PROVIDED TO STUDENTS IN VARIOUS FORMS. STANFORD IS COMMITTED TO A NEED-BLIND ADMISSIONS POLICY, ADMITTING QUALIFIED UNDERGRADUATES WITHOUT REGARD TO THEIR ABILITY TO PAY AND PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM FOR ALL ADMITTED UNDERGRADUATES WHO HAVE NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY AND WHO MEET OTHER REQUISITE CONDITIONS FOR FINANCIAL AID. MORE THAN 82% OF UNDERGRADUATES RECEIVED SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE DURING THE TAX YEAR AS WELL AS 87% OF ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS FROM STANFORD AND OTHER SOURCES. THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID INCLUDES $248,847,732 IN MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS. AN ADDITIONAL $135,841,085 REFLECTS AMOUNTS PAID FOR ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STUDENTS, INCLUDING PAYMENTS FOR HEALTH INSURANCE, LIVING EXPENSES, AND SUPPORT OF POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWS. THESE AMOUNTS INCLUDE $1,950,139 IN GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. GRANT RECOMMENDATIONS FROM DONOR ADVISED FUNDS, AS LISTED IN PART II, ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY SENIOR OFFICIALS IN THE OFFICE OF DEVELOPMENT. SUB-GRANTS STANFORD OCCASIONALLY RECEIVES GRANT SUPPORT THAT IS DISBURSED TO OTHER INDIVIDUALS OR ENTITIES PER THE TERMS OF THE AWARD. IN MOST CASES, PRIOR TO THE GRANT TO STANFORD, THE UNIVERSITY WILL PROVIDE THE GRANTING ENTITY WITH A LIST OF SUCH CONTEMPLATED RECIPIENTS. GENERALLY, AS WORK ON THE GRANT PROGRESSES, CHANGES TO THESE RECIPIENTS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE GRANTING AGENCY. DUE TO THESE REVIEW REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANTING AGENCY, STANFORD DOES NOT REPORT SUCH PAYMENTS ON FORM 990, SCHEDULE I.
CONTINUALLY MONITOR SATISFACTORY PROGRESS AND VERIFY AGAINST ORIGINAL SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Although students and their families bear the primary responsibility for meeting costs, many find they cannot pay the full cost of an education by themselves. In most cases a financial aid package will involve family contributions, acceptance of federal assistance (including grants and loans), and financial aid from John Brown University. These financial assistance programs help fill the gap between the amount a family is expected to pay and the total educational cost. The amount the family is expected to pay is based on information provided on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).

BURLINGTON COLLEGE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP: BURLINGTON COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO RETURNING STUDENTS IN THE SPRING SEMESTER AND APPLIED TO THE SUBSEQUENT FALL TUITION. RECIPIENTS MUST BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING AND HAVE AT LEAST ONE YEAR'S ENROLLMENT AT THE COLLEGE. STUDENTS MAY APPLY FOR THESE AWARDS OR BE NOMINATED BY FACULTY, STAFF, OR OTHER STUDENTS. AWARD RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED IN MID-APRIL AND STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED OF THEIR AWARDS THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT THAT TIME. AWARD RECIPIENTS ARE PUBLICLY RECOGNIZED AT CONVOCATION IN SEPTEMBER. AWARDS ARE GENERALLY $500-$1,000 PER YEAR THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE VERMONT FIRST SCHOLARSHIP: THE VERMONT FIRST SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO THE TOP TWO ACADEMICALLY RANKED GRADUATES OF EVERY VERMONT PUBLIC OR INDEPENDENT HIGH SCHOOL APPROVED BY THE VERMONT BOARD OF EDUCATION. THE OPPORTUNITY TO ATTEND BURLINGTON COLLEGE TUITION-FREE FOR THE FIRST YEAR, AND FIFTY PERCENT TUITION-FREE FOR THREE ADDITIONAL YEARS. ONE YEAR OF FULL-TIME TUITION FOR 2013-14 HAS A VALUE OF $22,410. THERE IS NO REQUIRED APPLICATION. STUDENTS OR GUIDANCE COUNSELORS WHO BELIEVE THAT THEY QUALIFY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP NOTIFY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT FINAID@BURLINGTON.EDU . APPLICANTS MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS: 1) BE A VERMONT STATE RESIDENT AS DEFINED BY VERMONT STUDENT ASSISTANCE CORPORATION 2) PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION OF CLASS RANK 3) BE A CURRENT-YEAR GRADUATE OF A PUBLIC OR INDEPENDENT HIGH SCHOOL APPROVED BY THE VERMONT BOARD OF EDUCATION 4) APPLY FOR ADMISSION AND ENROLL FULL-TIME AT BURLINGTON COLLEGE FOR THE FALL SEMESTER. 5) REMAIN ENROLLED FULL-TIME FOR CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP 6) APPLY FOR STATE AND FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. 7) MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, INCLUDING A 3.0 GRADE POINT AVERAGE, TO QUALIFY FOR CONTINUATION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP BURLINGTON COLLEGE PRESIDENTIAL AWARD: THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE PRESIDENTIAL SCHOLARSHIP OF $20,000 IS AWARDED TO SELECT FIRST-YEAR STUDENTS WHO REFLECT THE VALUES OF OUR COLLEGE: A COMMITMENT TO LEARNING, CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, CREATIVITY AND LEADERSHIP. THE SCHOLARSHIP IS DISBURSED AT $2,500 PER SEMESTER. ONCE ENROLLED RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE SCHOLARSHIP. BURLINGTON COLLEGE TRUSTEE AWARD: THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE TRUSTEE AWARD FOCUSES ON THE TRAITS AND QUALITIES A STUDENT DISPLAYED IN HIGH SCHOOL AS WELL AS FUTURE POTENTIAL. THIS GRANT IS RENEWABLE PROVIDED THAT THE STUDENT MAINTAINS GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING AND MAKES A POSITIVE CONTRIBUTION TO THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE COMMUNITY. THESE AWARDS RANGE FROM $500 - $5,000 FOR FULL-TIME STUDENTS DEPENDING ON THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS BURLINGTON COLLEGE WORK STUDY: BC WORK STUDY IS AWARDED TO FIRST TIME, FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID AND DO NOT MEET THE NEED CRITERIA FOR THE FEDERAL WORK STUDY PROGRAM. AWARDS ARE $500 IN BURLINGTON COLLEGE WORK STUDY. THESE AWARDS MAY BE AVAILABLE TO OTHER FULL AND PART-TIME STUDENTS ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS DEPENDING ON THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS, THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL UNMET NEED AND THE STUDENT'S ABILITY TO WORK ADDITIONAL HOURS. BURLINGTON COLLEGE COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISCOUNT: THE BC COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISCOUNT IS A 20% DISCOUNT GIVEN TO STUDENTS WHO TRANSFER FROM THE COMMUNITY COLLEGE OF VERMONT WITH AN ASSOCIATE DEGREE WITH A MINIMUM GRADE POINT AVERAGE OF 2.5 OR FROM OTHER OUT OF STATE COMMUNITY COLLEGE WITH AN ASSOCIATE DEGREE WITH A MINIMUM GRADE POINT AVERAGE OF 3.0. ONCE ENROLLED, RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE SCHOLARSHIP. THE AWARD EXCLUDES STUDENTS WHO ARE COVERED UNDER VA BENEFITS, EMPLOYEE TUITION REIMBURSEMENT OR SIMILAR DISCOUNTS. BURLINGTON COLLEGE YELLOW RIBBON MATCH: THE BC YELLOW RIBBON MATCH IS GIVEN TO ELIGIBLE POST 911 VETERANS. IN COMBINATION WITH FUNDS FROM THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION, BURLINGTON COLLEGE PROVIDES AN ADDITIONAL GRANT TO ENSURE THAT ELIGIBLE VETERAN OR ELIGIBLE DEPENDENTS HAVE NO OUT-OF-POCKET EXPENSES FOR TUITION AND FEES. BURLINGTON COLLEGE VERMONT NATIONAL GUARD DISCOUNT: THE BC VERMONT NATIONAL GUARD DISCOUNT IS A 25% DISCOUNT GIVEN TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ACTIVELY SERVING IN THE VERMONT NATIONAL GUARD OR WHO ARE A SPOUSE OR CHILD OF AN ACTIVE GUARDSMAN. BURLINGTON COLLEGE GRANT: THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE GRANT IS AN INSTITUTIONAL AID PROGRAM THAT EXISTS TO BRIDGE THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN TUITION COST AND FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY. BC GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WITH FINANCIAL NEED WHO MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THESE AWARDS MAY BE AS MUCH AS $5,000 FOR FULL OR PART-TIME STUDENTS DEPENDING ON THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. 1. CANNOT OWE A REFUND ON A FEDERAL STUDENT GRANT NOR BE IN DEFAULT ON A FEDERAL STUDENT LOAN, AND MUST BE CURRENT ON THEIR BURLINGTON COLLEGE PAYMENT PLANS 2. MUST BE RECEIVING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID AND EXHAUSTED ALL OTHER AVAILABLE AID INCLUDING LOANS, STATE GRANTS AND WORK STUDY. 3. MAY NOT BE ON DISCIPLINARY PROBATION. 4. MAY NOT BE RECEIVING THE CCV TUITION DISCOUNT, VNG GRANT OR SIMILAR TUITION DISCOUNTS. BURLINGTON COLLEGE GRANT IS DETERMINED BY TWO METHODS: 1. NEW STUDENTS ARE AWARDED UP TO $5,000 FOR BILLABLE COSTS WHICH ARE NOT COVERED BY THE STUDENT EFC AND FINANCIAL AID THROUGH A COMMITTEE DETERMINATION. CONTINUING STUDENTS ARE AWARDED UP TO $3,500 FOR BILLABLE COSTS WHICH ARE NOT COVERED BY THE STUDENT EFC AND FINANCIAL AID THROUGH A DETERMINATION BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. 2. EACH SEMESTER STUDENTS CAN APPLY FOR THE BURLINGTON COLLEGE GRANT BY APPLICATION FOR SMALL BALANCES WITH THE BC BUSINESS OFFICE. BURLINGTON COLLEGE FSEOG: THIS FUND WAS CREATED TO REPLACE FEDERAL FSEOG AFTER THAT FUND HAS EXPENDED. IT IS AWARDED TO NEW ADMITTED, FULL TIME, DEPENDENT STUDENTS. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO PELL-ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO DO NOT RECEIVE CCV DISCOUNT, STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE OR WHOSE STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE IS LESS THAN ORIGINALLY ESTIMATED. THIS FUND WILL PRIMARILY BE REPLACE WITH FEDERAL FSEOG ONCE AWARDS ARE TAKEN DOWN FOR STUDENTS WHO END UP ATTENDING ANOTHER COLLEGE. BURLINGTON COLLEGE ALUMNI DISCOUNT: THE BC ALUMNI DISCOUNT IS A 15% DISCOUNT GIVEN TO STUDENTS WHO GRADUATED FROM BURLINGTON COLLEGE WITH A BACHELOR DEGREE.

Students submit an application for financial aid to the financial aid office. Applications are evaluated by the financial aid office and students are notified of awards they are to receive. The financial aid is applied directly against tuition. Scholarships are not refunded should the student fail to complete the required credit hours.
TUITION REDUCTIONS WERE GIVEN QUARTERLY TO ALL STUDENTS WHO ENROLLED IN THE LICENSE VOCATIONAL PROGRAM AT ANNENBERG SCHOOL OF NURSING AND HAD AN ACCEPTABLE GRADE IN THE IMMEDIATE PRIOR QUARTER.

ALL HOOD COLLEGE GRANTS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY AWARDS, PERKINS LOANS AND MOST STAFFORD LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED. HOOD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AS EVALUATED THROUGH THE STUDENT'S HIGH SCHOOL RECORD AND SAT SCORES. MANY SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES ALSO INTEGRATE NEED BASED AWARDS. ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS REQUIRE REPORTING OF FUND USAGE.

FINANCIAL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO COVER ANY OUTSTANDING INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES. ANY CREDIT BALANCE IS REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT TO BE USED FOR OTHER EDUCATIONAL-RELATED EXPENSES. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AND/OR STATE AID MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). BY SIGNING THE FAFSA, THE STUDENT AGREES THAT THEY "WILL USE FEDERAL AND/OR STATE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ONLY TO PAY THE COST OF ATTENDING AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION."
FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS AWARDS OF ALL FEDERAL FUNDS TO STUDENTS

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: FOR THE GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS, THESE REPRESENT SUBRECEIPIENT GRANTS. A SUBRECEIPIENT AGREEMENT IS SIGNED BY BOTH MMC AND THE SUBRECEIPIENT STATING THE AMOUNT OF THE AWARD, THE AWARD NAME, THE NAME OF THE FEDERAL AGENCY, REQUIREMENTS IMPOSED BY LAWS, REGULATIONS AND THE PROVISIONS OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT. THE MONTHLY SUBRECEIPIENT INVOICES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR PRIOR TO PAYMENT TO VERIFY THE FEDERAL FUNDS ARE USED FOR AUTHORIZED PURPOSES AND ARE INCLUDED IN THE AWARD BUDGET. FOR THE NURSING SCHOLARSHIPS, AS AN APPLICATION REQUIREMENT, EACH SCHOLARSHIP APPLICANT MUST PROVIDE CONFIRMATION OF ENROLLMENT IN A PROGRAM OF STUDIES IN NURSING. FOR THE MEDICAL EDUCATION SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS IN THE MAINE TRACK OF THE MMC.TUSM MEDICAL SCHOOL PROGRAM, THE MEDICAL CENTER TRANSFERS THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO THE TUFTS SCHOOL OF MEDICINE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT FOR DISBURSEMENT TO THE STUDENTS. TUFTS HANDLES ANY OVERSIGHT TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED. MAINE MEDICAL CENTER'S ROLE IS LIMITED TO MATCHING ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WITH SCHOLARSHIP SELECTION CRITERIA AND DETERMINING WHO RECEIVES EACH SCHOLARSHIP AWARD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART III, NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ESTIMATES THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS FROM RECORDS MAINTAINED IN OUR FINANCIAL AID (SCHOLARSHIPS) AND ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SYSTEM (GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANCE STIPENDS AND FELLOWSHIPS) WHICH HAVE BEEN CLASSIFIED BY THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND OTHER STUDENT RELATED FINANCIAL AID MUST BE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM AUTHORIZED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TO RECEIVE A STIPEND, THE INDIVIDUAL MUST BE A STUDENT AND MEET THE REQUIRED GUIDELINE FROM THE AWARDING AGENCY. EACH DEPARTMENT CHAIR VERIFIES THAT THE STUDENT MEETS THE AWARDING AGENCY'S GUIDELINES. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE PAYMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SPECIFIC GUIDELINES CREATED BY THE SOURCE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY AND MONITORS USE OF FUNDS.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - By accepting grants, organizations affirm that (I) the gift will be used exclusively in furtherance of your proper exempt purpose; (II) no private benefit, goods or services were received by any individual or entities; (III) this gift is not in satisfaction of a pledge or other personal financial obligation of any individual or entity; and (IV) the gift will not be used for political activity or lobbying purposes; (V) the gift will not be used to pay for school tuition-apart from an established scholarship program; (VI) if used outside the U.S., it is in compliance with all applicable U.S. laws relating to such use.

ALL FEDERAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DURING THEIR AWARD PROCESS. FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN BY THE CONTROLLER IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ARE RECONCILED TO THE AWARD. THE MONEY IS DISBURSED TO THOSE APPLICABLE STUDENTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE BURSAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule I, Part i, Line 2
ExplntnTxt: DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED IS INTENDED TO BE USED FOR THE GENERAL OPERATING PURPOSES OF THE DONEE. THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS NOT MONITORED AFTER GRANTS ARE GIVEN.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS TO DOMESTIC ORGANIZATION - NEIGHBORHOOD NETWORK DEPARTMENT RECEIVES GRANT APPLICATIONS FROM NEIGHBORING ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS FOR REVITALIZATION THEIR BUSINESS IN AND AROUND THE HOPE VILLAGE INITIATIVE AREA. ONCE THE REQUEST FOR GRANT FUNDS HAVE BEEN REVIEWED AND AWARDED, PERIODIC REIMBURSEMENT REQUESTS ARE RECEIVED WITH SUPPORTING SCHEDULES SUCH AS INVOICES, PURCHASE ORDER AND PAYMENT MADE AS A RESULT OF A QUALIFYING GRANT EXPENSE. THE NEIGHBORHOOD NETWORK MANAGER REVIEWS THE REIMBURSEMENT REQUEST WITH ALL THE SUPPORTING SCHEDULE TO ENSURE THAT THE REQUEST IS IN COMPLIANCE AND THEN A CHECK IS MADE PAYABLE TO THE GRANTEE. GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS - STUDENT SERVICES DEPARTMENTS MAINTAIN RECORDS TO VERIFY ELIBILITY BASED ON TEST SCORES, INCOME LEVEL , AND VARIOUS OTHER REQUISTIES TO DETERMINE THE NEEDS OF THE QUALIFYING STUDENTS BEFORE THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED. FURTHER, TO RECEIVE 100% SCHOLARSHIP MINIMUM HOURS OF CLASS ATTENDANCE IN THE GIVEN COURSE PERIOD IS A REQUIREMENT.
LA SALLE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS RECORDS TO QUANTIFY THE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF THE STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AWARDED, THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS PER GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP, AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

Grant funds are monitored through an electronic packaging program for all students. The electronic program determines the eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding against a series of pre-established eligibility criteria. Once the program determines each student's eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant funding. The information is also checked by a member of the Student Financial Planning staff.

Gannon awards scholarships to freshmen and transfer students who meet eligibility standards for merit based aid such as academic and leadership awards. In addition, need based aid is considered for students who demonstrate financial need by filing the required applications and adhering to deadlines. Award packages are renewed each year to students that remain in academically good standing and continue to meet the required eligibility standards for both types of merit and need based aid. Students need not apply for specific scholarships since they will automatically receive consideration for all funds for which they may be eligible when they submit the FAFSA.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE PROCESSES FINANCIAL AID REQUESTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICERS FIRST DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL AND STATE STUDENT AID THAT THE STUDENT WILL RECEIVE. STUDENTS ARE THEN AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THEIR AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND OUTSTANDING CHARGES.

GRANTS ARE PROCURED BY FACULTY WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE COLLEGE'S GRANT MANAGER. MONITORING IS DONE BY GRANTEE, GRANT MANAGER AND SENIOR ACCOUNTANT FOR COMPLIANCE. ACTIVITY IS AUDITED AND REPORTED ANNUALLY IN THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
- The Institutions scholarship committee awards scholarships on a non-discriminatory basis, considering academic qualifications or distinctive scholarship crieria.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED WITH EACH GRANT. FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL MONITOR EACH GRANT ALONG WITH THE TOTAL AID RECEIVED BY EACH STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS COLLECTIVE AWARDS ARE WITHIN THE GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE KEPT IN STORAGE FOR SEVEN YEARS. PREVIOUSLY UNFUNDED APPLICANTS FOR GRANT MONIES FROM BEREA COLLEGE APPALACHIAN FUND (BCAF) FOLLOW CRITERIA AND A FORMAT WHICH ARE CLEARLY STATED ON THE PROGRAM WEBSITE: HTTP://WWW.BEREA.EDU/APPALACHIANFUND/APPLYINGFORGRANT.ASP. PREVIOUSLY FUNDED APPLICANTS MUST PROVIDE A DETAILED REPORT ON THE USE OF THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S GRANT FUNDING. THIS FORMAT AND CRITERIA ARE LOCATED ON THE SAME LOCATION OF THE BCAF WEBSITE. IN ADDITION, THE BCAF SPONSORS A GRANTEE CONFERENCE EACH SPRING WHEN ALL GRANTEES FOR THAT YEAR MEET AND CONDUCT PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS OF THEIR GRANT FUNDED WORK. THE BCAF IS IN REGULAR CONTACT WITH GRANTEES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, VISITING EACH NEW GRANTEE AND REPEAT GRANTEES WHERE POSSIBLE. THE STAFF OF GROW APPALACHIA, INCLUDING THE DIRECTOR AND TWO ASSISTANT DIRECTORS, ALL INDIVIDUALLY REVIEW FUNDING PROPOSALS FROM THE POTENTIAL PARTNER SITES FOR QUALITY OF PROGRAMMING, OUTREACH ACTIVITIES AND BUDGET LINE ITEMS. THIS STAFF THEN MEET AS A GROUP AND DISCUSS EACH PROPOSAL AND EITHER APPROVE THEM AS SUBMITTED, REJECT THEM OUT OF HAND, ACCEPT THEM CONDITIONALLY ASKING FOR CLARIFICATION OR REQUEST MORE INFORMATION TO ALLOW A SOUND DECISION. WHEN THE INFORMATION REQUESTS ARE MET THE STAFF MEET AGAIN AND EITHER ACCEPT OR REJECT THE PROPOSAL. GROW APPALACHIA ALSO HAS AN ADVISORY BOARD CONSISTING OF COLLEGE AND NON-COLLEGE MEMBERS WHO ARE KEPT INFORMED OF GROW APPALACHIA'S ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAM DIRECTION AND WHO THEN OFFER ADVICE AND COUNSEL FOR THE PROGRAM. FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL AND OTHER GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL INFORMATION GAINED FROM THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) THAT IS COMPLETED EACH YEAR. A THIRD-PARTY SOFTWARE VENDOR PROVIDES THE FEDERAL REGULATIONS BY WHICH GRANTS ARE GIVEN. THE FAFSA INFORMATION COMES FROM ELECTRONIC FILES WHICH ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED.ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE STORED ELECTRONICALLY AND ARE PASSWORD PROTECTED. DISBURSEMENTS ARE REVIEWED DAILY TO INSURE ACCURACY.

Financial aid awards are disbursed to students based on the general criteria for institutional financial aid.

DONATIONS ARE MADE TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE PURPOSES ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES OF LIBERTY UNIVERSITY. LIBERTY UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS CONTACT WITH ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE USE OF THE FUNDS ARE APPROPRIATE. GOVERNMENT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ARE MADE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AS PRESCRIBED BY FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. PRIVATE AND INSTITUTION FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON PROGRAM CRITERIA, WHICH INCLUDED SCHOLASTIC MERIT, ATHLETIC EXCELLENCE, ARTISTIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED, HIGH SCHOOL ATTENDED, FIELD WORKED AND SUPERIOR SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, SCH I, Part I, line 2
ExplntnTxt: Monitoring the use of grants The Office of Financial Aid processes all students' financial aid awards based on guidelines set forth by federal, state and local governments. These awards are included in the student financial package and are applied to the students' accounts once all eligibility requirements are met. The Office of Financial Aid reconciles all federal funds to the US Department of Education Common Origination and Disbursement system on a monthly basis. In addition, the Controller's Office reconciles the award disbursement activities posted to the Institute's General Ledger account to the Students' Accounts receivable ledgers and Financial Aid awards reports. The Controller's Office also handles the reimbursement requests, reconciliation of funds received and monitor the spending level to ensure that actual disbursements does not exceed the authorized government grant.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO OFFERS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED BY: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO; FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; SOCIAL, FRATERNAL, PROFESSIONAL, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; EMPLOYERS, BOTH PRESENT AND PROSPECTIVE; AND FRIENDS AND GRADUATES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS CAN BE USED TO PAY FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, TRANSPORTATION AND PERSONAL EXPENSES; GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE ELIGIBILITY BY SUBMITTING A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION, COMPETE IN INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS, ARE ACADEMICALLY ELIGIBLE, OR ARE READY TO COMMIT THEIR TIME AND SKILLS AFTER GRADUATION TO THE U.S. ARMED FORCES.

THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY AWARDING THOSE FUNDS ONLY TO ENROLLED STUDENTS TO BE USED FOR STUDENTS' TUITION AND FEES. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN AUDIT BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR ON AN ANNUAL BASIS PURSUANT TO OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part I Description of Procedure for Monitoring Use of Funds
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO TUITION AND FEES INCURRED AT THE UNIVERSITY AND NOT PAID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS. MONITORING CONSISTS OF RECORD KEEPING FOR INTERLA USE AND REVIEW OF ELIGIBILITY.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IN CONFORMANCE WITH ESTABLISHED POLICIES ON THE BASIS OF BOTH NEED AND SCHOLASTIC MERIT. TUITION DISCOUNTING IS BASED ON CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY APU'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AWARDS TO STUDENTS WITH NEED ARE BASED ON THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID FILED WITH THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. THE APU APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION CONTAINS INFORMATION UTILIZED FOR SCHOLARSHIP AWARD. AID IS DETERMINED AND AWARDED ON AN EQUAL BASIS TO RECIPIENTS WITH SIMILAR ATTRIBUTES. PART III(B) NUMBER OF PARTICIPANTS: RECIPIENTS HAVE RECEIVED ONE OR MORE AWARDS FOR WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE.

GEISINGER-LEWISTOWN HOSPITAL (GLH) DOES NOT AWARD GRANTS BUT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR 501 (C)(3)STATUS UNDER THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, LIMITED 501(C)(4) ORGANIZATIONS BASED ON EXPLICIT CRITERIA, PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE ACTIVITIES FURTHER THE EXEMPT PURPOSE OF GLH. GLH NOTIFIES THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OR NON-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS OF THE INTENT AND PURPOSE OF THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION. ORGANIZATIONS SEEKING SUPPORT MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT THEY EFFECTIVELY MEET AN IMPORTANT COMMUNITY NEED.
The college manages Federal Title IV grant funds in accordance with Title IV regulation. The college undergoes an annual A-133 audit to monitor the use of the funds.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF EACH RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN LIMESTONE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. AS FUNDS ARE RECEIVED THEY ARE POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO ADMITTED STUDENTS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF THEIR ACADEMIC PROFILE AND A CAREFUL ANALYSIS OF THEIR DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS AWARDED GRANT FUNDS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND REMAIN ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY ON A FULL TIME ACADEMIC BASIS. AT THE END OF EVERY TERM, EACH STUDENT'S ACADEMIC STATUS (I.E., GPA) IS MONITORED TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL GRANT FUNDS RECEIVED. FOR MONITORING PURPOSES, ELECTRONIC REPORTS GENERATED FROM OUR DATABASE ARE UTILIZED FOR THE AWARD DETERMINATION AND STATUS REVIEW PROCESS. THE UNIVERSITY ENSURES THAT ITS GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY CREDITING THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL AID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RATHER THAN ISSUING CHECKS.

ITU REQUIRES SCHOLARSHIP APPLICANTS TO SUBMIT EVIDENCE OF ELIGIBILITY, REFERENCE LETTERS AND DEMONSTRATES ONGOING RECORDS OF SCHOLASTIC ACHIEVEMENTS BY ALL RECIPIENTS. SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WILL THEN DETERMINE THE RECIPIENTS BASED ON THEIR GPA AND DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED.

There is a publication of available scholarships and the criteria to qualify for each one. Students complete an application indicating which scholarship(s) they are applying for. These applications are reviewed by the registrar's office during the registration process and qualifying students are determined. Of the $85,639 of financial assistance awarded during the FYE 5/31/14, $83,389 were scholarships which were applied as a credit against the students' tuition. The remaining $2,250 of financial assistance was distributed as cash to students who qualified for scholarships funded by outside sources.

A FILE IS CREATED FOR EACH GRANTEE. WE DETERMINE EACH STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED BASED ON THEIR COST OF ATTENDANCE MINUS EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION ACCORDING TO THE INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT INFORMATION RECORD FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR. WE ATTEMPT TO MEET EACH STUDENT'S DEMONSTRATED NEED WITH A COMBINATION OF MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, NEED-BASED GRANTS, FEDERAL COLLEGE WORK-STUDY, AND STUDENT LOANS. FINANCIAL AID MAY BE AWARDED FROM FEDERAL, STATE, INSTITUTIONAL, AND PRIVATE SOURCES. WE MONITOR AND MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE MONITORS AND MAINTAINS SEPARATE FUND ACCOUNTS FOR EACH AWARD CATEGORY AND PROVIDES THE NECESSARY REPORTS TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES.
THE ORGANIZATION ONLY MAKES GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE TAX-EXEMPT UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: For all scholarship funds, financial aid has established specific criteria for eligibility and selection. The eligibility requirements are documented and monitored for compliance. Scholarshps are credited to student tuition bills.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MUST SUBMIT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND CONCORDIA'S APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. CHURCH-WORK STUDENTS MUST ALSO COMPLETE A DECLARATION OF INTENT FROM THEIR HOME CHURCH. WHEN ALL REQUIRED FORMS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED IN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (SFS), SFS COMPUTES THE STUDENT'S ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC) AND COMPILES AN AWARD PACKAGE OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS AND WORK STUDY PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REQUIRES THAT A STUDENT BE ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION OR ENROLLED AND MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS ACCORDING TO ESTABLISHED STANDARDS.

THE COLLEGE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNTS OF TUITION ASSISTANCE INCLUDING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. THIS OFFICE ENSURES THAT FUNDS ARE PROPERLY CREDITED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND MONITORS STUDENTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

MANAGEMENT OF THE UNIVERSITY HAS CONTROLS IN PLACE TO MONITOR THE USE OF ALL GRANT FUNDS. EACH DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING ALL AMOUNTS CHARGED TO GRANT ACCOUNT NUMBERS IN THE GENERAL LEDGER. THE DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS REVIEW OVERALL USE OF SCHOLARSHIP AND OTHER GRANT FUNDS TO ENSURE THAT THE RECIPIENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THE FUNDS. MANAGEMENT REVIEWS EACH DEPARTMENT'S REPORTS OF GRANT SPENDING ON A REGULAR BASIS, AND THE BUSINESS AFFAIRS COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES RECEIVE QUARTERLY FINANCIAL REPORTING PACKAGES FOR REVIEW AS WELL.

DESCRIBE ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. THE UNIVERSITY REQUIRES THAT WHEN APPROVING INVOICE PAYMENTS TO SUBRECIPIENTS, THE VALIDITY OF EXPENSES MUST BE VERIFIED ALONG WITH THE ACHIEVEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL PROGRESS BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE. THIS VERIFICATION INCLUDES SIGN OFF BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE ON THE INVOICE APPROVING IT FOR PAYMENT. SUBRECIPIENT INVOICES SHOULD INCLUDE INFORMATION THAT CONFORMS TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS AS PRESCRIBED IN OMB CIRCULARS A-110 AND A-133. SUBRECIPIENTS EXEMPT FROM A-133 AUDIT REQUIREMENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAKE THEIR FINANCIAL RECORDS AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW OR AUDIT BY FEDERAL AGENCIES OR PASS-THRU ENTITIES AS REQUESTED, UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THEIR AGREEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART II, COLUMN H (1)THE CONTRIBUTION TO THE VERMONT IBUTWA INITIATIVE WAS MADE TO PROVIDE GENERAL SUPPORT OF THEIR MISSION TO BUILD SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS FOR THE WOMEN OF SOUTH KIVU PROVINCE IN THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE CONGO, PROVIDE MEDICAL TREATMENT AND SUPPORT TO CONGOLESE WOMEN AFFECTED BY RAPE AND HIV/AIDS, AS WELL AS TO RAISE AWARENESS IN VERMONT ABOUT THE CRISIS. THE COLLEGE INCORPORATES THIS ORGANIZATION INTO ITS CURRICULUM BY INVITING VERMONT IBUTWA INITIATIVE TO PRESENT THEIR MISSION TO THE PEACE AND JUSTICE CLASSES. THE COLLEGE ALSO HAS A FACULTY GROUP THAT MEETS REGULARLY TO ACT AS THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE FOR VERMONT IBUTWA INIATIVE AND THE STUDENT ASSOCIATION HAS FORMED A CLUB TO HELP CARRY ON THE MISSION OF THE GROUP. (2)THE CONTRIBUTION TO SAINT ANNE'S SHRINE WAS MADE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT OF THEIR MISSION TO SERVE AS A WELCOMING PLACE OF PEACE AND HOPE MINISTERING TO ALL GOD'S PEOPLE THROUGH PRAYER, DEVOTION, HOSPITALITY AND SPIRITUAL RENEWAL. THE SHRINE WAS DEVELOPED AND MAINTAINED FOR THE PAST 100 YEARS BY THE SOCIETY OF SAINT EDMUND, WHO IS ALSO THE FOUNDER OF SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE SHARES A SIMILAR MISSION TO CONTRIBUTE THROUGH HIGHER EDUCATION TO THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE HUMAN PERSON AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF HUMAN CULTURE IN THE LIGHT OF THE CATHOLIC FAITH. THE COLLEGE BENEFITS FROM USE OF THE FACILITIES AT THE SHRINE FOR CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENT, STUDENT AND STAFF RETREATS AND WORSHIP.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART III THE COLLEGE RECOGNIZES THE HIGH COST OF A PRIVATE EDUCATION AND ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS AS MUCH AS WE PRACTICALLY CAN TO CLOSE THE GAP BETWEEN THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND FAMILY RESOURCES USING A VARIETY OF SOURCES, INCLUDING FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL (COLLEGE) FUNDING. THE THREE TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WE EMPLOY INCLUDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS AND STUDENT EMPLOYMENT. IN 2013-2014, THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERED OVER $53 MILLION IN ASSISTANCE, OF WHICH APPROXIMATELY $34 MILLION WAS PRIMARILY COLLEGE FUNDED AID SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS. THE FIVE YEAR-AVERAGE (2009-2013) OF UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVING COLLEGE FUND AID WAS 92.9%. THE COLLEGE'S PRACTICE HAS BEEN TO AWARD AID BASED ON MERIT AND/OR NEED TO ALL STUDENTS ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION. THE AVERAGE NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT FOR THE FALL 2013 INCOMING CLASS WAS APPROXIMATELY $21,247. THE AMOUNT OF AID A STUDENT RECEIVES UPON INITIAL ENROLLMENT GENERALLY IS AWARDED FOR EACH YEAR HE/SHE ATTENDS SAINT MICHAEL'S COLLEGE.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S GRINNELL COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON FUND AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY GRINNELL COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH GRINNELL COLLEGE POLICY. STUDENTS AWARDED OTHER FUNDS MAKE VARIOUS REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS ON THEIR RESEARCH OR STUDY AS REQUIRED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUNDING. THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ENHANCEMENT AND ENGAGEMENT. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF FACULTY, STAFF AND GRINNELL COLLEGE STUDENTS FROM THE LOCAL AREA. ALL FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS FOCUS ON THE STRATEGIC PRIORITIES OF STRENGTHENING CULTURAL, RECREATIONAL, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN THE LOCAL AREA AS WELL AS INITIATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE SAFETY, BEAUTY, AND ECONOMIC VITALITY OF OUR SURROUNDINGS. GRINNELL COLLEGE HAS ASSEMBLED A DIVERSE SELECTION COMMITTEE TO EVALUATE NOMINEES FOR THE GRINNELL COLLEGE YOUNG INNOVATOR FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE PRIZE. APPOINTED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT, THE SELECTION COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE ALL RECOGNIZED INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR SOCIAL CHANGE IN VARIOUS CAPACITIES. THEIR BACKGROUNDS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND EXPERIENCES REFLECT THE DIVERSITY IN BOTH GRINNELL AND THE STATE. THESE MEMBERS INCLUDE ONE REPRESENTATIVE EACH FROM THE COLLEGE'S FACULTY, STUDENT BODY, ALUMNI, STAFF AND TRUSTEES, PLUS PROMINENT INDIVIDUALS NOT FORMALLY AFFILIATED WITH GRINNELL.

DAVIDSON COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES AND METHODOLOGIES FOR DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. FOR MERIT-BASED GRANTS, DAVIDSON AWARDS THE GRANTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STIPULATIONS OF THE UNDERLYING GOVERNING INSTRUMENT (I.E. DONOR ENDOWMENT AGREEMENTS, AND OTHER DONOR DOCUMENTATION). DAVIDSON MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS OF COMPLIANCE FOR ALL GRANTS DISBURSED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE ADMISSION DEPARTMENT AND OTHER DEPARTMENTS WILL FORWARD REPORTS TO THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT INDICATING WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFIED FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THEIR FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC TALENT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED THAT DOCUMENT THE STUDENTS' FINANCIAL NEED, ELIGIBILITY TO QUALIFY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS, AND THE AMOUNTS AWARDED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S. DUKE UNIVERSITY PERIODICALLY APPROVES GRANTS AND TRANSFERS GRANT FUNDS TO NUMEROUS ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES. FOR SUBGRANT RECIPIENTS, A SERIES OF INTERNAL CONTROLS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED WHICH INCLUDE DETERMINATION OF WHETHER AN AUDIT WILL BE REQUIRED. DUKE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED A DETAILED AND COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROCESS WHICH ENSURES PROPER PURPOSE AND USE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS PRIOR TO ENGAGEMENT. FOLLOWING THE PROCUREMENT PROCESS, DUKE UNIVERSITY MONITORS SUBSEQUENT BILLING AND PERFORMANCE OF THE GRANT RECIPIENTS. INVOICES MUST BE SUBMITTED ACCORDING TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS WHICH MIRROR THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE ULTIMATE GRANTOR. PRIOR TO PAYMENT, CENTRALIZED DEPARTMENTS REVIEW DOCUMENTATION TO ENSURE THE EXPENSES ARE ALLOWABLE WITHIN THE TERMS OF THE GRANT. ULTIMATELY, THE ORGANIZATIONS AWARDED THESE GRANTS MUST MONITOR THE APPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IN THE ORDINARY COURSE OF BUSINESS AND REPORT SUCH INFORMATION TO DUKE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS' INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID IS POSTED DIRECTLY TO THEIR BURSAR ACCOUNTS. THEREFORE, SUCH FUNDS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO APPROPRIATE CHARGES WITHIN THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. GRANT/FELLOWSHIP PAYMENTS ARE PROCESSED ACCORDING TO AWARD LETTERS, WHICH ARE REVIEWED AND SUBMITTED TO THE RECIPIENT IN ADVANCE OF ACCEPTING FOR THE APPLICABLE SEMESTER. EACH PAYMENT IS PREPARED ACCORDING TO THE AWARD LETTER BY A DEPARTMENTAL REPRESENTATIVE, WHICH IS THEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY A DEPARTMENTAL SUPERVISOR. PRIOR TO ISSUANCE, A FINAL REVIEW AND APPROVAL IS PROCESSED BY THE CENTRAL PAYMENT PROCESSING DEPARTMENT.

BIDWELL TRAINING CENTER AWARDED GRANTS SPECIFICALLY TO ITS AFFILIATES. UNDER COMMON MANAGEMENT, IT IS VERIFIED THAT THESE FUNDS WERE USED SPECIFICALLY AS DESIGNATED FOR OPERATING SUPPORT. GRANTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS GIVEN TO OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS ARE OFTEN PASS-THROUGH GRANTS. REPORTING IS DONE AS REQUIRED BY THE ORIGINAL FUNDERS REQUIREMENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY UTILIZES THE POWERFAIDS FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WHICH REQUIRES THE END USER TO TIE HIGHLY SPECIFIC ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA TO INDIVIDUAL AID PROGRAMS. DURING EXECUTION OF THE AUTOMATED AWARDING MODULE WITHIN POWERFAIDS AID IS ALLOCATED BASED ON THE PRE-ESTABLISHED CRITERIA ENSURING THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY DISTRIBUTED TO APPROPRIATE, QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS. POST AUTO-AWARDING A SERIES OF MIS INFORMATION REPORTS PERFORM A STUDENT-BY-STUDENT TEST OF AWARD EFFICACY MONITORING THAT STUDENT GRANT AID HAS BEEN APPROPRIATELY DISTRIBUTED. WITHIN THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS SYSTEM AND GENERAL LEDGER STUDENT GRANT PROGRAMS EXPENDITURES ARE ASSIGNED SUB-CODES THAT UNIQUELY IDENTIFY THEM AS SUCH THUS PROHIBITING ANY INADVERTANT OR INAPPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED APPROPRIATE CONTROLS THROUGH SEPARATION OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND INTERNAL AUDIT PROCEDURES THAT PRECLUDE ANY ENTITY WITHIN THE ADMINISTRATIVE STRUCTURE FROM DIVERTING STUDENT GRANT AID TO NONQUALIFIED USES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN D
ExplntnTxt: THE "NON-CASH ASSISTANCE" REPORTED ARE CREDITS AGAINST STUDENT TUITION CHARGES.

NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. AMOUNTS OF AID AWARDED ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH GOVERNING REGULATIONS OR INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. IN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV REGULATIONS, TOTAL AID FROM ALL SOURCES CANNOT EXCEED NEED OR THE ANNUAL COST OF TUITION, REGARDLESS OF THE LEVEL OF NEED. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT ACCOUNT AND FUNDS ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS. OVERPAYMENT OR CREDIT BALANCES OF STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE ANALYZED PRIOR TO DISTRIBUTING REFUNDS TO STUDENTS TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROPERLY AWARDED AND UTILIZED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

MONITORING PROCEDURES SCHEDULE I PART I #2 DECISIONS REGARDING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL AID TO APPLICANTS WHO, WITHOUT SUCH AID, WOULD BE UNABLE TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DETERMINES A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE ANALYZES THE NEEDS OF ALL STUDENTS, AND BASED ON THE COMMITTEE'S ANALYSIS AID IS AWARDED AS NEEDED AND POSTED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.
The College uses Academic Works software, an excel spreadsheet, and a series of contracts within its billing system to track and maintain activity for recipients of tuition assistance.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.
THE SCHOOL APPLIES THE MONIES GRANTED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION DIRECTLY TO TUITION COSTS.

GRANTS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITIES' POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS WELL AS LAWS AND REGULATIONS.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 1 The grants department and the financial aid office oversee all grants, government loans and scholarship expenditures. All grant expenses are approved and reimbursed in accordance with University policy. An annual audit is conducted in accordance with governmental regulations.
GRANTS CONSIST OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS TO ATTEND CORCORAN COLLEGE OF ART. IN GENERAL, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT TO OFFSET TUITION AND FEES.
GRANTS CAN BE USED FOR TUITION ONLY.

COLGATE UNIVERSITY OFFERS GRANTS & LOANS TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MEET CERTAIN ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. GRANTS AND LOANS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS AND THEIR PARENTS COMPLETE EXTENSIVE APPLICATION MATERIALS, SUBMIT TAX RETURNS AND OTHER SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THEIR CLAIM FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. COLGATE ALSO OFFERS A LIMITED NUMBER OF ATHLETIC SCHOLARSHIPS (NON-NEED BASED) THAT ARE AVAILABLE FOR SELECT INTERCOLLEGIATE SPORTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART II, LINE 1
ExplntnTxt: COLGATE UNIVERSITY RECEIVES VARIOUS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS AND OTHER SUPPORT FROM LOCAL ENTITIES THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR. THE ENTITIES SELECTED TO RECEIVE GRANTS, AS LISTED IN PART II, ARE SELECTED TO RECEIVE FUNDING SOLELY FOR LOCAL PURPOSES.

MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE MODEST AND ARE APPROVED BY OUR OFFICE OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND MONITORED BY THE PRESIDENT'S CABINET. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS TAKE THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO OUR STUDENTS. THE SOURCE OF FUNDING OF THESE SCHOLARSHIPS MAY BE UNIVERSITY INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, GOVERNMENT FUNDS OR DONOR FUNDS. UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ADMISSIONS OFFICE, BOTH GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE, AND AWARDED USING A CALCULATION DRIVEN BY PRIOR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE STATISTICS. GOVERNMENT FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS AND AWARD CRITERIA. DONOR FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS, WHETHER SPONSORED OR ENDOWED, ARE AWARDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH STRICT ADHERENCE TO THE DONOR'S WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA. THE UNIVERSITY'S DEVELOPMENT OFFICE WORKS WITH THE DONOR AT THE TIME OF THE GIFT TO ESTABLISH THE WRITTEN AWARD CRITERIA AND THESE CRITERIA ARE MAINTAINED FOR REFERENCE IN BOTH THE UNIVERSITY'S EXTERNAL AFFAIRS AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICES.

Form Sch I Part I Line 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH THE NECESSARY STAFF, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THE UNIVERSITY ADHERES TO AND COMPLIES WITH FEDERAL REGULATIONS REGARDING ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ADEQUATE STAFFING IN ITS OTHER GRANT PROGRAMS WITH ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE, THE UNIVERSITY ALSO UNDERGOES THE REQUIRED OMB CIRCULAR A-133 AUDITS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. WESTERN UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE ADVANCEMENT DEPARTMENT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARD COMMITTEES AWARD THE RECIPIENTS.

VASSAR COLLEGE RAISES FUNDS FOR, AND MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO, A WIDE VARIETY OF 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN THE GREATER POUGHKEEPSIE AREA. THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE SELECTED ANNUALLY BY A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES AND STUDENTS AFTER A REVIEW OF THEIR ACTIVITIES AND MISSION. EMPLOYEES AND STUDENTS ALSO VOLUNTEER TIME AT EACH ORGANIZATION. FUNDS ARE COLLECTED ANNUALLY FROM THE GIFTS OF EMPLOYEES, STUDENTS, TRUSTEES, AND FRIENDS OF THE COLLEGE AS PART OF THE "COMMUNITY WORKS" CAMPAIGN. AT TIMES THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SMALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER LOCAL NON-PROFIT AND GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES WHO ARE NOT PART OF THE CAMPAIGN.

STUDENTS WHO ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS HAVE FUNDS CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT AND THE USE IS RESTRICTED TO PURPOSES RELATED TO ENROLLMENT IN A PROGRAM OF STUDY. RECIPIENTS OF FELLOWSHIPS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT PERIODIC WRITTEN REPORTS OF THEIR ACTIVITIES TO THE COLLEGE.

Defiance College awards financial aid on the basis of merit and on the basis of demonstrated need determined in conjunction with the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Defiance College scholarships are awarded to eligible students in varying amounts up to full tuition the first year and are renewed each year according to established renewal requirements. Defiance College awards are coordinated with federal, state, and other outside financial aid award programs.
The College maintains records for all students receiving financial assistance administered by the College. Records include the financial and academic performance records relative to award decisions.

LAGRANGE COLLEGE AWARDS BOTH MERIT-BASED (NON-NEED-BASED) AND NEED-BASED AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS. MERIT-BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, LEADERSHIP, AND TALENT. NEED-BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY FAMILY INCOME AND ASSET INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BY A REVIEW 0F A STUDENT'S COMPLIANCE WITH SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS STANDARDS, GRADE POINT AVERAGE FOR THE CONTINUATION OF MERITBASED AID, AND SUBMISSION OF A RENEWAL FAFSA IN AWARDING 0F NEED-BASED AID. THERE WERE 904 STUDENTS AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN 2013-2014.
THE SF SPCA ISSUES GRANTS TO OTHER ANIMAL WELFARE GROUPS THAT RESCUE ANIMALS. THE GRANTS ARE BASED ON THE NUMBER OF ANIMALS RESCUED AND ADOPTED.

MANY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THE ORGANIZATION ARE ALSO BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR SALISH KOOTENAI COLLEGE FOUNDATION AND THEY OVERSEE AND ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE UTILIZED PROPERLY. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES.
THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCING IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MONITORING OF ALL STUDENT AID. ALL GRANT AID IS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING STERLING COLLEGE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS & GRANTS ARE NON-CASH AWARDS, REQUIRING THE AWARDS TO BE USED AS A DIRECT REDUCTION IN TUITION COST.
THE UNIVERSITY GRANT POLICY IS CONTAINED IN ALL ADMISSIONS MATERIAL, IN THE UNYVERSITY CATALOG, AND CAN ALSO BE FOUND ON THE UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE.
GETTYSBURG COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS ARE DESCRIBED ON SCHEDULE F, PART IV.
The University's financial aid department monitors and maintains records regarding all financial aid awards.

THE COLLEGE HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHICH FOLLOWS THE FEDERAL LAWS REGARDING STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING AID AND COLLEGE GRANTS. STUDENT GRANTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNTS AS A PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO ANY OTHER ORGANIZATIONS OR INDIVIDUALS.
THE ORGANIZATION MONITORED THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS BY SEEING STUDENTS COME TO THE LAB WEEKLY TO BE TUTORED.

THE UNIVERSITY PAYS GRANTS/ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA STIPULATED BY THE DONOR. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, SERVICE AND FAMILY SITUATION. THE PROCESS IS MONITORED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE. FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID, THE PROCESS IS GOVERNED BY A MULTI-STEP REVIEW PROCESS INVOLVING SEVERAL STAFF FROM THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT.

Monitoring the use of grant funds The assistance provided to governmental entities is in the form of donations in-lieu of real estate taxes. The amounts are intended to help fund services normally provided by the entities.

PART I, LINE 2 Each fiscal year the amount of University funded scholarships and discounts for the year is determined in conjunction with the University's budget-setting process. Actual financial aid awards are based on different criteria and are tracked within the approved budget. The administration of financial aid is handled by the student finance office and such aid awarded is credited directly to the student's account. Each student applies for financial aid by filling out the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). The award is based on information provided in this application. Students can also apply for grants and scholarship based on eligibility.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT MONITOR THE USE OF FUNDS PROVIDED TO LORETTO BOROUGH.
SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE MERIT-BASED AND ARE USED TO PAY FOR THE PROGRAM TUITION. STUDENT GRADES ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS.

The University has numerous procedures to ensure students qualify for scholarships and other assistance both at the time of the award and subsequent thereto. These procedures ensure compliance with applicable Federal and state regulations, stipulations of scholarship criteria and University policies for awards made from the University.

Valparaiso University is committed to providing resources necessary to help students complete their education. In selecting the students to receive this assistance, the University places primary emphasis on the student's academic achievement and financial need. Awards are determined by the University Scholarship Committee. Upon enrollment verification, the awards are used to offset the cost of attendance.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Description of Organization's Procedures for Monitoring the Use of Grants
ExplntnTxt: Form 990, Schedule I GRANTS IN SUPPORT OF NORTHWEST COMMUNITY HOSPITAL'S (HOSPITAL) MISSION ARE MONITORED BY NORTHWEST COMMUNITY'S FINANCE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS PART OF THE MONTHLY REVIEW OF HOSPITAL'S FINANCIAL RESULTS. SIGNIFICANT GRANTS TO UNRELATED 501(C)(3) OR GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS ARE APPROVED BY HOSPITAL'S COMMUNITY SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND ARE MONITORED THROUGH ONGOING INTERACTIONS WITH OFFICIALS OF THOSE RECIPIENTS REGARDING PROGRAM SERVICES PROVIDED IN HOSPITAL'S SERVICE AREA.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND OTHER VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE DEPARTMENT CHAIR AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE SERVES AS THE COORDINATING DEPARTMENT FOR ALL TYPES OF FUND RAISING PROGRAMS AND FOR SOLICITATION OF GIFTS. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS/RESTRICTIONS ARE MADE AND MONITORED BY ADMISSIONS OFFICE AND DEANS. THE ACCOUNTING STAFF RECORDS THE TRANSACTIONS IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS DEVELOPED A QUANTIFIED ANALYSIS OF OUR AWARDING PRACTICES AND POLICIES. THESE PRACTICES AND POLICIES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY TO DETERMINE WHETHER CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO OUR PHILOSOPHY AND FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING PHILOSOPHY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS- SCHEDULE I, PART IV
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER ARE SELECTED AND THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR LOANS DETERMINED BY OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY PROCESSES APPLIED TO ALL SIMILARLY SITUATED INDIVIDUALS. THE DECISIONS ARE MADE ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS THROUGH EVALUATING THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED OF THE APPLICANT IN LIGHT OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR THIS PURPOSE. --------------------

IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER MAKES SUB-AWARDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT PERFORM RESEARCH IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT CATEGORIZE THESE SUB-AWARDS AS "GRANTS" FOR FORM 990, SCHEDULE I REPORTING, SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS WHICH SERVE THE DIRECT NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 The University awards need-based and merit-based grants and scholarships, as well as various federal, state, and private scholarship, loan, and student work programs as part of its overall financial aid program. The University Financial Aid office is responsible for management of all financial aid programs.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2, Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEEDS ASSESSMENTS AND/OR PERFORMANCE. ONCE THE STUDENT HAS BEEN APPROVED TO RECEIVE THE GRANT, THE AMOUNT IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S BAKER COLLEGE ACCOUNT. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS THE STUDENT TO MAKE SURE THE AWARD STAYS IN COMPLIANCE. IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT CONTINUE TO MEET THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS, THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAY BE REDUCED. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE BUDGETED EACH YEAR BY THE BAKER COLLEGE CAMPUS. THE CAMPUS PRESIDENT DETERMINES WHICH ORGANIZATION BENEFITS FROM A GRANT BASED ON THE COMMUNITY'S NEEDS. IF THE GRANT EXCEEDS THE BUDGET, THE BOARD OF REGENTS MUST APPROVE THE FUNDING. THESE GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE ARE AWARDED TO OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS TO BE USED IN ANY WAY THE RECIPIENTS SEE FIT TO FURTHER THEIR MISSION AND TAX EXEMPT PURPOSE; THE USE OF THESE FUNDS IS NOT MONITORED BY THE BAKER COLLEGE CAMPUS.
